data: {"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"LocalBusiness","name":"St. Patrick Catholic School","image":"https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/5gDFzdfgbx13lyx1j8CZ3Q/l.jpg","telephone":"(760) 729-1333","address":{"streetAddress":"3820 Pio Pico Dr","addressLocality":"Carlsbad","addressCountry":"US","addressRegion":"CA","postalCode":"92008"},"review":[{"author":"Bronwen F.","datePublished":"2017-03-27","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"Fabulous School. \nThey provide amazing education and a safe loving environment. We are very very happy!"},{"author":"Gabriela S.","datePublished":"2019-02-23","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"Totally agree with Jill O comments.  Our child has improved reading and math skills in short time, 1st graders are reading at 3rd grades (public school) level books.  The STAR reports are above average on the national rating (75%+) The teachers really work with every kid to reach their maximum potential. (personalized teaching!) you can bet better than this! The building is state of the art and well organized staff. The religious academics are strong, they hold up to the standards; we recently relocated from the bay area and went to a catholic school there and the difference between religious education is much robust at St. Pats! We are loving it here! There are lots of fundraising even which is part of any catholic school wherever you go around the globe!"},{"author":"Kelly S.","datePublished":"2016-01-30","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"The best school!  My son goes here and the teachers and staff are all above and beyond fantastic.  The perfect balance of faith and teaching math, science, music, computers and everything they need to know to prepare them for the future.  All the students from Kindergarten to 8th grade are good souls and really good kids which I attritibute to the families they are raised in and the teachers at St Pats."},{"author":"Jen P.","datePublished":"2015-12-13","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":1},"description":"This school is the most un-godlike establishment EVER.... All they want is $$ and they sucker young families into their guilt driven goals for a new school. They care NOTHING about the families, and are a disgrace to the Catholic Religion."},{"author":"Kenia F.","datePublished":"2017-02-20","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"Great catholic community, teachers are not only teaching academics but lifelong lessons of kindness, caring, and love."}],"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingValue":4,"reviewCount":5}}

{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"LocalBusiness","name":"Little Cubs Learn and Play Daycare","image":"https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/4sU6qFP35cECzeioOCgmpA/l.jpg","telephone":"(205) 690-8600","address":{"streetAddress":"1040 14th St","addressLocality":"Calera","addressCountry":"US","addressRegion":"AL","postalCode":"35040"},"review":[{"author":"Nijah J.","datePublished":"2022-07-08","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":1},"description":"If I could give zero stars I would This place is so unprofessional and has absolutely no experience in caring for children.They have no interest in taking care of little ones. They have absolutely no genuine care and concern for anyone's child. Their main concern is money! They give the impression that they have the level of competency to nurture any child as long as they are not a danger to the other children. Our son was not a danger to anyone in that facility and this baby sitters club terminated him after 3 hours. They could not give us any clarification on why they terminated him. Only that he was crying and wandering off in the hallways. They also told us he acted like a toddler. When he is in fact a TODDLER! Whom was born before the pandemic and has never been away from his parents. They insinuated that something was wrong with our child while our child has never had any issues and has never been diagnosed with anything. Absolutely refused to give us our tuition back. I would have respected them if they could have taken a professional meeting with us. Please Beware! They are continuously enrolling because they have very little children and staff left! Oh and this is a Real Review! I know the owner keeps commenting stating none of these reviews are real. Oh yes BEWARE BEWARE BEWARE!"}],"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingValue":1,"reviewCount":1}}

The campus and its surrounding areas are really nice and clean.   I recently attended a ceremony in the school's auditorium and it was very spacious.  Anytime I have attended an event here, it's always crowded ; thankfully, parking is usually pretty good."}],"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingValue":5,"reviewCount":1}}

{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"LocalBusiness","name":"American Village","image":"https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/qcMzPbNfXlghO-k2jcYYiQ/l.jpg","telephone":"(205) 665-3535","address":{"streetAddress":"3727 Hwy 119","addressLocality":"Montevallo","addressCountry":"US","addressRegion":"AL","postalCode":"35115"},"review":[{"author":"Staci J.","datePublished":"2021-03-12","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"Warmer weather, sunny days which means flowers begin to bloom. 

We took a quick day trip to American Village to pick tulips (which is my favorite flower).  The staff was friendly with plenty of greetings and smiles. 

Admission is $5 and free if you are a veteran. 

You are provided a basket to put your tulips in. 

There are many varieties and colors to choose from. It is definitely worth the visit."},{"author":"Steve H.","datePublished":"2022-08-20","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":4},"description":"Great place experience what it was like when the United States got started.  Lots of good family entertainment."},{"author":"Connie L.","datePublished":"2021-11-12","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"Beautiful historically accurate facilities and costumes.  Excellent  programs.   Set on gorgeous acreage.  Easy to find.  Well run by friendly staff.
     Wonderful place for people of all ages to learn about and  celebrate America's unique history.
(Sorry for all of the incorrect words in this review, but Yelp insists on changing what I typed to other words. If there's a way to turn off spellchecker on yelp, I don't know where it is.)"},{"author":"Mark N Tim E.","datePublished":"2021-07-05","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"05/31/2021, Memorial Day, this place is a must see, it is absolutely amazing, the role players are amazing, you truly feel like you have stepped back in time, it is a full immersive experience! Such an amazingly fun way to learn and experience history! Also, the people work at American Village are so nice too. For example, Jodie Waysoluka, the kind lady who drove the shuttle bus picked us up at the parking lot, since my brother has knee trouble and our friend uses a wheel chair. She told us about the events happening that day and Jodie Waysoluka is very knowledgeable about the American Village, and she was kind, and patient too. We look forward to our next trip to American Village. God bless! Mark N Tim Elders, Birmingham, Alabama"},{"author":"Gregory S.","datePublished":"2016-10-18","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"Great place for: field trips, weekend museum day with kids or yourself as as an adult, honoring and informing oneself on wars and veterans, witnessing and participating in reenactments, seeing smaller scale replicas of historical buildings.

I think I'd like to visit again for some of their event themes throughout the year: Christmas and Memorial day"},{"author":"Sonya S.","datePublished":"2018-04-17","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":3},"description":"Attended today as a chaperone. Wasn't too impressed with program they had designed for  us. I've previously visited and remember the lessons being more interactive, fun, & detailed."},{"author":"Erik G.","datePublished":"2019-11-10","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"We came with My school, mom and stayed a half day.  We were asked history questions that most of us got wrong but the actors were real in their costumes.  They had us act out parts to know how the US was formed.  I want to know more about my family history."},{"author":"Ed H.","datePublished":"2016-07-04","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"Awesome place to spend 4th of July.  Be sure to bring cash.  Lots of activities & presentations every bit as good as Williamsburg.  Best fireworks show in central Alabama!"},{"author":"Michael N.","datePublished":"2013-03-04","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"If you enjoy the history of our great nation this is the place for you. I went to a wedding there recently and the facilites are top notch. The reception was held in a Barn that was remodeled and was perfect for events."}],"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingValue":4.5,"reviewCount":9}}

{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"LocalBusiness","name":"Carlsbad Country Day School","image":"https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/ntfRCBGgAS21gKjRH2r89w/l.jpg","telephone":"(760) 804-0550","address":{"streetAddress":"5150 Hemingway Dr","addressLocality":"Carlsbad","addressCountry":"US","addressRegion":"CA","postalCode":"92008"},"review":[{"author":"Rena E.","datePublished":"2022-04-26","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"This is a great school, probably the best private preschool you can find in the area. I made a thorough research before sending my 2 daughters there and although it is expensive, it totally worths the extra $$ . 
To begin with the half day program is 8.15-3.15pm, long enough compared to other schools. The teachers are all great. Ms Breanna, Ms Leslie, Ms Rachel, Ms Alysse etc. In half day program they also offer lunch and healthy snacks which is great.
My oldest daughter started when she was 2.5 yo and my youngest started at the Infant day care program 16mo, since the first day that I left her at the CCDS I felt safe and knew she was in the best hands. 
I have a very good experience even during covid-19 difficult time they managed to stay open and that was amazing.The staff is great, all friendly, polite and willing to help you. The only annoying part is that they do a lot of % increases in the tuition fees, which sometimes doesn't really make sense. Other than that, I give 5 stars and more, my daughters learned so many things and they were always happy during drop off and pick up time. We also met so many nice families there. 

CCDS you ROCK!"},{"author":"Gary A.","datePublished":"2022-05-04","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"Amazing school.  Quality, caring staff.  

My daughter learned so much!  Love the grounds, great space to get out and play. 

Really enjoyed this place.  Fun learning projects, school chef (so no packing lunch / snacks!) and a fall & spring performance! 

Absolutely worth the cost if it's in your budget."},{"author":"Eugene Y.","datePublished":"2022-06-06","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":1},"description":"The owner had an appointment with my friend and was so unprofessional! On the day of the appointment, my friend did not even get to meet Melissa who she's scheduled to meet.. Another staff member who also was unprofessional met with her instead for 10 minutes and rushed the meeting."},{"author":"Elisha V.","datePublished":"2021-05-19","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":1},"description":"I am rewriting my review of Carlsbad country day. Not because Yelp contacted me that someone is requesting to have it removed but because Yelp contacted me that someone was requesting it be removed and that upset me. So I went to my training session frustrated and my trainer encouraged me to take that negative energy and turn it into positive energy. So here is my effort to do so. 

I'm giving CCDS a one star because I believe this is not a healthy environment for children to learn and be supported developmentally.  As a parent whose child attended CCDS my 2 year old was restrained to a chair because after he finished snack he wanted to go play.  I saw this on camera and recorded the incident. I then immediately called the school and spoke to Ms Alize. She said she was told it was school policy to make kids at the age of two sit at the table until their friends finish snack. I told her that was NOT a developmentally appropriate practice and that I would speak to Melissa the administrator about the incident. 

I spoke to Melissa and she went to watch her video recording called me back and admitted that she saw the incident. She also said she would talk to Ms Alize. Unfortunately during the conversation I raised other concerns regarding the aggressive handling of the children at nap time, them not providing AM snacks and the overally structured learning environment. Melissa explained to me this is how she has done it for 20 years. I assured her if she is doing things from 20 years ago she has a lot to catch up on cause research shows that is not a conducive learning environment. She then said she does what works for her. I encouraged her to do what is right for the children and families. She then said maybe this is not a place for me and my child and threatened to disenroll my child. I then informed her about Title 22 regulations which do not allow that. But after seeing we had to very different philosophies I agreed that this was not a place I wanted my child. 

Melissa then refunded ALL my money. 

Because I am a mandated reporter I had to report the violation to my sons rights so I did. I notified CCLD and an investigation took place. Melissa denied the incident. 

I was very angry about the denial of what happened to my son and even more worried for no plan of correction. 

Here is the positivity... I wish Melissa and all the staff at CCDS to find it in their heart to do right by our kids. My hope is that they will find it in their heart to get properly  trained to better understand kids and how to care for and educate them in loving and inspiring ways.  I forgive Melissa and Ms. Alize and Ms. Stephanie who stood by and watched. I forgive those ladies for what you did to my son. Wishing the school, the staff and of course the kids all the best at CCDS."},{"author":"Cindy A.","datePublished":"2021-06-26","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"Carlsbad Country Day school has it all! Management is wonderful. You're definitely lucky if you have the opportunity to send your child here."},{"author":"Reza E.","datePublished":"2021-04-13","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":3},"description":"My kid was at CCDS for more than two years and he had already been with  5 different teachers! so I think I have a good understanding of the CCDS and staff. 
The school has enough space to be a good day school however the problem is the management and how they run the day school as a family business. Some of the teachers are good though we also had experience with bad teachers. But the main issue is the management and lack of professionality.
Honestly, I wouldn't recommend this daycare to any of my friends."},{"author":"Lindsay C.","datePublished":"2021-01-23","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"So happy to have our son in the infant room. Each teacher is nurturing, caring, and genuinely friendly. They do such fun and engaging activities, even with the littlest students. Highly recommend Carlsbad Country Day."},{"author":"Jennifer N.","datePublished":"2021-02-25","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"Love love love CCDS! My daughter is in Ms. Jaqueline's bilingual immersion class and we couldn't be happier. The school is very clean and the materials are kept in very good shape. The front is very responsive to any questions we have and accommodating to my ever changing schedule. Before CCD we went to a few schools that just didn't feel like home. We were hesitant to make another change by pulling our daughter out again and changing schools but now that we have found Ms. Jaqueline and the whole CCD staff, we know we made the right decision."},{"author":"Courtney G.","datePublished":"2019-05-15","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"I am sad to say my daughter just left CCDS :-( Only because we moved out of state. She was there from March 2017 - May 2019. She was in Ms. Lupe and Ms. Mariel's Spanish immersion preschool class. Before deciding to move out state we planned for her to be at CCDS through kindergarten. 

We could not be happier with our experience at the school. The peace of mind we had as parents dropping her off each day and the love our daughter had for the school was priceless. The love and care her teachers provided was incredible to see. The environment at school feels like family. 

Tuition includes breakfast, lunch and two snacks. You never have to stress about bringing food to school. The meal plan for lunches is unlike anything I've ever seen. Definitely not your standard kids menu offerings. There's an on-site chef who prepares their meals each day. 

Another awesome feature at the school is the webcams. You can log in it at anytime and watch what your child is up to from your computer or mobile device. It was especially great in the beginning when  we were leaving her with someone we didn't know for the first time. Then was just fun to sometimes peak in and see her in her school environment. 

The last thing I will highlight is the parent/family involvement. They offer a monthly parents night out at a far less expensive rate than a babysitter and your child gets to be with their friends in a familiar environment. There's a bowling tournament for parents twice a year, a father/daughter dance, another one for mother/son and other fun events. They also have a spring and winter festival where the children perform. 

CCDS is really something special. The campus is immaculate. Everyone is so friendly/helpful, they really take pride in their work. Yes the tuition is on the higher side but it's worth every penny. You absolutely get what you pay for. A huge thank you to Ms. Melissa the director, Ms. Bailey and Ms. Nely the assistant directors. I cannot imagine all the work it takes to keep the school operating as it does... flawlessly! Ms. Lupe and Ms. Mariel, thank you for loving Miss V as your own. We will miss you both so much. Last but certainly not least Ms. Laura in the infant/toddler room. We will never forget the care you provided when we first started at CCDS. We knew she was in the best hands from day one."},{"author":"Cindy F.","datePublished":"2020-08-30","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":4},"description":"Let me start by saying my daughters teacher Miss. Jackie is amazing! The school is very nice as well as their activities they do with the children. My only problem is this school is very expensive so if there is a holiday they also take the day after or before off as well. Overall nice school."},{"author":"Rebecca I.","datePublished":"2020-01-25","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"I I wanted to share a review for Carlsbad Country Day School as this week is our last there before we move out of state.   The experience my 5 year old has had there the past  three years has been extremely positive,  both from a great social experience, but the leaps and bounds he made in learning.   I believe the school has prepared him above and beyond for kindergarten this fall.    The teachers, the methods, the overall positive environment  was phenomenal.   The school itself is safe, secure, laid out beautifully and the staff is always friendly and engaging with both parents and kids.    We will miss the Winter Festival,  field trips and occasional parent night out opportunities the staff provided.    Director Mellissa Reed has built the perfect model for young kids to learn, have fun and learn important skills that I  believe would have been difficult to get anywhere else."},{"author":"Sally S.","datePublished":"2019-03-13","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"Our son has been at this school since he was about 5 months old. He is now in the two year old program and I couldn't be more pleased with this school. The teachers are wonderful and treat our son so well.  They are up to date on child development and provide our son with so much stimulating educational experiences. He is thriving and I give this school a lot of credit. 

Most importantly, I have peace of mind that he is safe and being treated well.  The teachers communicate with us frequently regarding milestones and updates. I feel so lucky to have found this school and I highly recommend it. They also have cameras that you can access anytime which is very nice."},{"author":"Rachel F.","datePublished":"2021-03-19","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"Carlsbad Country Day school is the best!!! The school is clean. The staff is outstanding. The staff go above and beyond for there students. The school has a great meal plan including lunch and snacks!! I would recommend anyone to compare this school to any other school. This school is the top of my list!!"},{"author":"Erin T.","datePublished":"2020-09-01","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":1},"description":"Our daughter has been enrolled in Carlsbad Country Day School for a year until Covid happened and everyone was asked to stay home.  Carlsbad Country Day School had asked all parents to prepay an entire month of tuition to reserve our spot until it was safe to return.  I received a one line email from Melissa Reed the director that our spot is no longer being held for us and our deposit is non refundable.  Melissa Reed has awful customer service and treats the parents very disrespectfully.  I am one of many parents who have been mistreated by Melissa Reed.  I would absolutely not recommend this school to anyone."},{"author":"D G.","datePublished":"2020-02-26","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"We have been at CCD for 7 months now & I wish we would have found this place sooner.
My son is so excited every morning when I tell him to wake up & time to get ready for school.He's even more exited & smiling ear to ear when I pick him up.We signed up our son in the bilingual class & he loves his teacher.All
Of the teachers & staff are amazing especially the director.She's greeting our family when we walk in & always checking in on how my son doing in class & even outside of school like when he's sick.I love that she always hosts events outside of school for families to get to know each other & make memories together with the staff and teachers as well.Its even more cute that they host father daughter dances and date night for mom and son as well.They even do date nights where you can drop off your child for a few hours & squeeze a date night in with your significant other.The teachers are always working on new activities with the children.I love getting those pictures during the day .His teacher is always keeping me up to speed with what's to come the following week .In the beginning my son was a little behind on speech & I have notice a tremendous difference in him since he has started.His pediatrician has told the same thing.I think that's what makes CCD so special and different from other preschools.They truly care about your child during this crucial time of growth & I wouldn't have chosen a better to school for him to be at."},{"author":"Jamil G.","datePublished":"2020-10-11","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"We are so grateful this school has been open throughout the COVID crisis. They have taken extra precautions to keep the children safe so parents who need to work can still function. Thank you CCDS!"},{"author":"Leighla E.","datePublished":"2019-02-23","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"My words can't express how grateful we are for CCDS. I was a stay at home mom for over 2 years and am often described as a "helicopter mom." I wanted to get back into the workforce but none of the childcare care options were up to our family's standards. When we found Carlsbad Country Day we were so excited! We had big expectations and they've exceeded all of them. Every teacher cares about the kids like their own, and they even provide personalized updates on each child's progress toward developmental milestones. Healthy food, clean spacious areas, the most caring and educated staff, incredible ownership, and an overall beautiful mission. I'm convinced that CCDS is the most superior early education institution of its kind."},{"author":"Vicky K.","datePublished":"2017-09-12","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"We have had our son enrolled in CCDS since he was six months. He is our first, so it was really hard to hand him over to someone you just met. But Miss Melissa, Miss Laura and the rest of the infant teachers really made that transition for us amazingly easy! And our son LOVES it. We couldn't be happier with our choice. CCDS stood out for us for us in our daycare selection because of their curriculum. We seriously lucked out to have such great teachers as well! Miss Melissa would give me daily updates on how our son was feeling/eating/sleeping etc. and really take the time to reassure me of whatever new mom worry I had. Even in the infant area, they have structured reading/activities time which is amazing. You set the baby's feeding schedule which is really nice. 

They helped my son transition to the toddler side at one year super smoothly and lucky for us Miss Melissa moved to the toddler side with our son (he happened to turn a year old during the transition) because he LOVES her. For a while she was the only one who could console him if something was wrong. Luckily he has opened up quite a bit! The curriculum on the toddler side is even better, jam packed with activities and outdoor play and set snack/meal times as well as a two hour nap midday. They track our son's milestones as well. They caught his first series of steps on camera for me and we get monthly updates on his progress at school. In the meantime CCDS has great perks for families as well. They host a monthly parents night out where they will watch your kids (for a fee) and they even have Moms night out (which is a great way for you to meet moms of all the other kids in your kids class!)

The last thing I love about CCDS is that they're really there to help the parents out and have since I am still breastfeeding my 15 month old, we even worked out an arrangement that now works for everyone! 

Our son comes home happy every day and that is a testament to the excellent care and curriculum provided by CCDS!"},{"author":"Bobbie S.","datePublished":"2016-01-31","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":3},"description":"In case anyone is wondering why so many reviews of this school all of the sudden it's because the director specifically  asked for reviews, and is tying teacher reviews to the number of mentions, see photo. Nothing wrong but seems suspect. 

There are some really good things about CCDS. The facilities are excellent, the teachers awesome, and the curriculum worthwhile.  The school serves food, and chef Stas is wonderful. 

On the negative side, teacher turnover is very high and there always seems to be new teachers I don't recognize. I know of one class that's had at least 6 teachers in the past two years. Fees are an issue. Tuition is high, and they charge extra for special classes that should be included at $1500/month."},{"author":"Anne W.","datePublished":"2020-01-17","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"This school has been a blessing. Our daughter has learned so much and both she (and I) have made life long friendships. My husband is a marine and last month when the holidays came around and we were short on funds, Melissa, the owner, took care of our bill for us and thanked my husband for his service. You can feel this warmth and generosity from the children to the staff. It's a great school, we highly recommend CCDS."}],"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingValue":4,"reviewCount":52}}

{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"LocalBusiness","name":"Healthcare Academy of Califorina","image":"https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/4RPJhG03K0zSEqgajmrw5w/l.jpg","telephone":"(760) 232-4050","address":{"streetAddress":"440 S Melrose Dr","addressLocality":"Vista","addressCountry":"US","addressRegion":"CA","postalCode":"92081"},"review":[{"author":"Jessica R.","datePublished":"2021-08-09","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"CNA & CPR Review.
CNA: I recently finished their CNA program. My instructor was Lauren (LuLu). I can honestly say she is a great instructor. Our class was considered too big to stay together for clinicals, so we were split into groups of 13 at two different facilities. My group ended up staying with Lauren, and the other with Donna. Very fast-paced. Theory for about 2 weeks, then clinicals for the remaining time. Lauren was very helpful throughout my time there. She is very smart, and answered every question thoroughly and explained it well. She was very hands on at the facility and was always there to offer help. Every time we'd be nervous, she would reassure us that it would be okay, and it always was. I would highly recommend this program, and Lauren. She made our time there fun, and I ultimately had a great experience because of her. She has a passion for helping others, and has a great personality to go along with it. Highly recommend!
CPR: I took the CPR class with Chuck on a Saturday. He charges a really great (low) price, and the class was only 3.5 hours! I highly recommend him if you need to be CPR certified or want to renew. He is very knowledgable. He explained thoroughly why CPR works the way it does and how it works. Anatomy and physiology right there for you. But he uses very simple terms and doesn't ramble. Take him! I know who to go to when I need to renew. Again, highly recommend!"},{"author":"Anthony V.","datePublished":"2022-02-21","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"Hands down the best accelerated EMT program in San Diego county. Great environment full of knowledgeable instructors and staff."},{"author":"Joan L.","datePublished":"2019-09-27","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"I took the 21 weekday CNA training program with Ms. Lauren. Lauren is an amazing instructor who was very helpful in every way. She has had tons of experience working in the field, so you know you're in good hands!
The theory portion of the class was fast and somewhat vague at times but it all made sense once we got to the skilled nursing facility for our clinicals. My instructor was on the floor with us everyday during clinicals. The first day was a bit overwhelming but over time, I felt very comfortable interacting with patients and performing skills.
By the end of the clinicals, my classmates and I felt more than prepared for our test. We were lucky that our state exam was scheduled the day after we officially finished the course. Everyone in my class passed!! Shoutout Ms. Lauren for being the best instructor!! 
This was such a great program and I would highly reccommend it to anyone looking to get certified or gain hands on experience/hours for PA/NP/Med School etc.!!"},{"author":"Karina E.","datePublished":"2021-08-04","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"So I took the CNA class this past month. I passed the state exam on the first try and I highly recommend you make sure Lauren will be your instructor if you choose to attend Healthcare Academy of California."},{"author":"Alex F.","datePublished":"2019-05-13","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"Charles "Chuck" Gardea is perhaps the best instructor I have ever had. I took the accelerated course and he made sure to cover every topic, in depth. He was also willing to meet up with us after class to ensure our success. Miss Janet is also great. After I completed my program and passed my test. Chuck reached out personally, to congratulate me. The program focuses on the success of each and every student without compromising integrity. The other students in my class have been just as successful as well."},{"author":"Laurie S.","datePublished":"2018-03-13","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":1},"description":"Be careful choosing this school!!!! 
I took the CNA class here and had a HUGE complication! I completed all of the theory with no problem. The instructor gave us ALL a flyer with a state testing site and location on it. I showed up to the test site location , an hour early, which was in Anaheim. When I got there none of my classmates were there! I called one of them and they said the test site was switched to Santee, which was almost 2 hours away! I missed my state testing date!!!!! I had NEVER heard of a new testing site location. You would think after paying $1,700 for this course, that they would have taken the time(1 minute) to print and deliver a new flyer with the new test site location & make it very clear to ALL of the students! 
I called the office and spoke to the office administrator, Janet, and she was very snotty, rude and unapologetic. If you read previous reviews, others have had similar issues with Janet. She stated that "I was looking for someone to blame."They even asked ME to pay for the "reschedule" of the testing, which was their error! They acted as if this  was my fault. I asked Janet if an email or a new flyer had been printed up stating that they moved the test site. Her reply was, no. I don't feel that we should have to rely on a "blue card" in the mail to verify our accurate test date. The instructor should make sure that it is VERY clear where the state testing site address is at. The instructor did NOT make it clear where the test site was switched to. Why would I drive to Anaheim (Orange County)if it was in Santee(San Diego County).I was enrolled in the RNA class but decided not to go back after the unprofessional, rude treatment I was given. There are many schools to choose from. Again, be careful!!!"},{"author":"Samah T.","datePublished":"2019-04-30","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"I loved my CNA program specifically because of my Instructor! I thank them for helping me through my journey to better my life for me and my family."},{"author":"Kayla R.","datePublished":"2017-01-31","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"I enrolled in the 21 day CNA program in September of 2016. I really enjoyed the class taught by Mrs. Terry.  The course was fun and well paced. I especially enjoyed the facility we did our clinical's at. I now frequently visit my favorite residents there :)

Class was extremely informative and I received a job during the program. I am actually now a Care Manager at a staffing agency in Carlsbad and get to use my CNA license and work closely with other medical professionals. 

I would highly recommend this school to anyone even curious about exploring the medical field. I met some great friends in this class.

Thanks again :)"},{"author":"Duffy R.","datePublished":"2014-04-02","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"The hardest part of any journey is the first step. So when I decided to change the course of my life and start working towards a career in the Healthcare industry, I was overwhelmed with how to start. With so many choices to choose from, I had no idea how I was ever going to get started. I knew I wanted to be a PA (Physician's Assistant) but that would take me at least 5 years minimum. I wanted to start working in a hospital setting immediately so I could have all that experience by the time I got my PA license and have many connections forged. 

I decided becoming a CNA was the best way to get my foot in the door. Now that I had that figured out, the next step was figuring out how and where I would take my classes. The first choice I had was taking courses at Mira Costa College. The downside to this was in order to even get into the program, I had to go on a wait-list that could take up to a YEAR! Even if I were to wait, I'd have to make sure I had the prerequisite classes completed as well. PASS.

Next up was Kaplan College. I took a tour of this school, and the lady that helped me was very nice. The program setup was really cool, as they teach you how not only to be a CNA but give you phlebotomy and EKG classes as well. This is good in the search for a job as it gives you way more positions to apply for and like they say, "The more you can do, the better." The downside to this option was THE PRICE! Their courses cost almost 2-3 times the amount they would at Mira Costa. You would either need loads of money or financial aid for your financial aid. PASS.

One day, I was online looking for jobs and happened across a listing saying "GET YOUR CNA LICENSE IN 21 DAYS!" Immediately, I clicked the link and saw information on Healthcare Academy of California. Obviously, I was skeptical. My first thought was SCAM! So I did my research and checked Yelp. The reviews were very positive but not enough to fully convince me, so I checked Facebook and saw more positive reviews. I knew these would be hard to fake since it would take lots of time to create multiple fake accounts. I even went so far as to message one of their former students and asked about her experience. She wrote me back and had positive things to say. Next, I decided to give them a call and spoke with Janet. She was so pleasant on the phone and answered all my questions. Tuition was more than fair and covered everything from books, to BLS certification, to scrubs and state exam fees. The classes were M-F 10a-6:30p or you could do an 11wk weekend course from 8a-4:30p. The classes were taught by an actual RN and depending on which course you took, this would determine which teacher you'd get. 

With all my information I had gathered, I pulled the trigger on Healthcare Academy of California and enrolled. They offer payment plans so you can break up tuition over 3 payments. Very cool. Janet gave me a tour of the classroom and they have a room that dubs as a mock hospital room with a dummy and all the supplies one would find in a hospital setting. 

Now I'm currently a student and approaching the end of my 21 day certification and I can EASILY say this program was the best choice not only for money and time but for the instructor as well. His name is Greg and he is a RN and makes the learning fun and easy. There is a heavy workload of homework but that's too be expected since it's an accelerated course. Luckily they give you plenty of time to work on your homework in class so you shouldn't have any issues not completing the assignments.  There is a test every class that covers the chapters went over in class the day before, so make sure you do the homework and you should ace them. Greg knows his stuff and if you follow his instructions, you should have no problem getting the 21 required skills down pat. Clinicals are held at an old folks home and this is probably the hardest part of the whole course. I don't personally like working there and don't want to work there post graduation, but I know they are the ones who hire new grads. That being said, Greg will pair you with a CNA and you will shadow them and apply your knowledge in real life sensations. 

All in all, I cannot say enough good things about this school. Even CNAs who went to Kaplan and Mira Costa said they wished they would've went thru HAC because of the reasons above. If you're looking for a change and want to join the Healthcare field, this is the best place to start. Make your first step the easiest part of your journey and join Healthcare Academy of California and take Greg's classes. You won't regret it."},{"author":"Octavia M.","datePublished":"2017-02-12","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"Highly recommend! My class took the state exam and we all passed!! If you're doing the day program for CNA, you'll thoroughly enjoy Mrs. Terry as an instructor! She gets you prepared and confident for the state exam. She makes the course fun which is a plus in this fast track program. She genuinely cares and wants you to succeed!! Thank you again Mrs. Terry!!!"},{"author":"Kayla K.","datePublished":"2016-02-22","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"This school was such a great experience! Both my teachers were great and I got a job right after I passed the state exam. They will guide you through steps if you need help. Nothing but positive things to say."},{"author":"Josh P.","datePublished":"2018-12-16","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"Healthcare academy helped prepare me to become a CNA in the short time period of 4 weeks. Immediately after passing the CNA exam I was offered a job with the nursing facility we did our clinical hours at. Lauren Joseph was the instructor for my class and she was fantastic. Lauren always did her best to make sure each student had ample time to perfect the skills required to work in the clinicals. I felt very prepared for the exam as well as being employed in the real world of healthcare."},{"author":"Jessamyn O.","datePublished":"2015-06-08","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"Healthcare Academy of California was an amazing experience. Jerald & Jessamyn"}],"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingValue":5,"reviewCount":22}}

{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"LocalBusiness","name":"The Agua Hedionda Lagoon Discovery Center","image":"https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/GP3QDOQbb9-vkmXsNQ_rIA/l.jpg","telephone":"(760) 804-1969","address":{"streetAddress":"1580 Cannon Rd","addressLocality":"Carlsbad","addressCountry":"US","addressRegion":"CA","postalCode":"92008"},"review":[{"author":"Alize R.","datePublished":"2022-06-26","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"What a great find. {"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"LocalBusiness","name":"The Clubhouse Social Skills Center For Children","image":"https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/SdNKC94nDwWYKwLcLO0USg/l.jpg","telephone":"(760) 683-5359","address":{"streetAddress":"6832 Embarcadero Ln","addressLocality":"Carlsbad","addressCountry":"US","addressRegion":"CA","postalCode":"92011"},"review":[{"author":"Timothy V.","datePublished":"2015-10-24","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"Anna is absolutely amazing! Our son has been coming here for a couple of months now, and has been working on his interpersonal and social skills through the PEERS program, as well as continuing that training in the less formal LEGO club.

Each program is designed to aid children who need assistance in developing and growing their social skills, and our son has been making leaps and bounds since starting here! Our son has Asperger's syndrome, and Anna has been wonderful in working with him. We did all of our homework, and her credentials all check out (which is something that we always do before working with a service provider.)

Both of our boys come for LEGO club, and both of them look forward to it each week, even though we get up fairly early each Saturday to get there. LEGO club proved to be an excellent starting point for the boys, and allowed them to really grow comfortable in the setting before we got the PEERS program set up for our eldest. 

Now, to the details: the facility is absolutely beautiful. Build inside a dual use location in Carlsbad, the downstairs is set up for the program. Tastefully decorated, it is fun, light, and airy, with plenty of slightly subdued colors that look delightful without being overwhelming. There are plenty of toys, and the collection of LEGO's is constantly expanding. There is a good mix of special needs and typical children, which allows for real interactions that are all supervised and directed by Anna and her staff. Everyone is incredibly friendly, welcoming, and accepting. We truly could not be happier!

Would I recommend her to family and friends? Absolutely, and have already gone out of my way to do so. If you have a child that is struggling with social interactions, if you have a child who needs a boost, if you have a child who just doesn't quite get it, this is the place to go. We have already seen honest-to-goodness measurable improvements (which as an aside is something that is also done through the PEERS program.)

In summary, this program is excellent and Anna makes it all seem so easy. And, if I'm honest, I've probably picked up a pointer or two for applying in my own life as well."},{"author":"Mooki H.","datePublished":"2017-11-05","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"My child participated in Ana's summer camp for two summers.  The camp counselors all have higher education and training in child development and social skill coaching.  The low child to staff ratio allows high level of attention and support to the needs of each child.  Summer camp includes outdoors play everyday and field trip every week.  Ana knows each kids and spend time to communicate to parents about their progress.  Highly recommended."},{"author":"Debbie S.","datePublished":"2015-06-26","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"The clubhouse is simply amazing and Ana is even more so. I cannot recommend this location enough for children that need some additional social skills to help them navigate through their days."}],"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingValue":5,"reviewCount":3}}

As someone who's always been a terrible singer, I learned so many things during my lessons and I am a MUCH more confident singer than I am before. I'm never going to be singing on Broadway, but I highly recommend lessons even if you have no intention of ever becoming a singer or even doing a live performance. Besides being really fun, I use to feel shy about singing in the car or trying to sing someone a song that I forgot the name of the song, but the lessons has given me confidence to be more expressive with my voice. I loved that Jiyoung challenged me and pushed me to improve my vocal technique. 
Secondly, I found the CML billing platform very easy to use. They billed me via e-mail every month and it was simply a few clicks to pay and they sent a detailed invoice with every payment that was easy to save.
I can't speak on the other teachers, but for voice lessons Jiyoung is great. I will note though, that you can't just take lessons once a week and expect to improve much. Yes, just learning better technique can already dramatically improve your singing, but it also takes a lot of your own time and practice. I had to unfortunately pause lessons for now because I became busy with a lot of things, but in the future once I have some free time again I'm looking forward to starting lessons back up."},{"author":"Lauren S.","datePublished":"2021-05-25","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"We have loved CML and especially Mr. Chris, our piano teacher!

We often recommend CML to our friends."},{"author":"Mona R.","datePublished":"2021-06-17","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"Hannah is lovely. She is patient and motivates my girls. Also, I really doubt that the teachers saw all that much of the payments that I was forking over to CMS."},{"author":"Jinsoon S.","datePublished":"2020-07-08","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"My two daughters are taking voice lessons. My opinion of this place has totally changed. I am absolutely loving my guitar lessons. They are the best!"},{"author":"Frank J.","datePublished":"2018-12-03","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":1},"description":"I haven't had a lesson in months and California Music Studios is still billing me. This has been a problem since the start of working with California Music Studios--even when I was out of town and my instructor told them we had no lessons, they still charged me. Now, as I said, I haven't had a lesson in months and I'm still getting charged. 

I do want to point out that my instructor was great. I honestly wish I could have worked directly with him because California Music Studios--aside from setting up the relationship--has caused nothing but problems. I understand they need to be compensated for putting together instructor and student, but they really mismanage the logistics and I'm sure are taking way too big of a cut for the "service" they provide. You're better off finding an instructor on craigslist and working with them directly. That way, the instructor makes more money and you pay less by cutting out a useless middleman."},{"author":"Brendan M.","datePublished":"2016-04-09","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"Our daughters have been receiving singing, piano and flute lessons from CMS for many years now and we couldn't be happier. The exposure to playing at live events is invaluable to the learning experience and CMS works hard to help make your child's performance experience a positive one. 

If you are looking to expand your children's horizons I highly recommend CMS."},{"author":"Jessica C.","datePublished":"2017-09-01","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"Our sons's piano teacher had to leave abruptly, and I was panicking trying to find another teacher that would be as good and that would be willing to travel to our home.

{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"LocalBusiness","name":"Children's House Montessori School","image":"https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/X-6UEqT8V7AaFBHGOnkJhg/l.jpg","telephone":"(760) 930-9041","address":{"streetAddress":"3093 Rancho Del Canon","addressLocality":"Carlsbad","addressCountry":"US","addressRegion":"CA","postalCode":"92009"},"review":[{"author":"Madeline L.","datePublished":"2020-04-16","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"To any parents looking for a quality education with a wonderful, nurturing teacher, you'll find this at Children's House Montessori. My daughter has been a student at Mrs. Manika's school for the past two years. Unfortunately, due to COVID-19, she no longer attends physically at the school. However, Mrs. Manika has continued with online learning, which has been engaging.

The best part of this program is the educator, Mrs. Manika. She is a compassionate teacher, with amazing patience. Children's House is a small, home-based program, that I was extremely fortunate to find. Mrs. Manika is very attentive to the specific needs of your child. In addition to keeping parents updated on the progress of the student, we are also invited to the school multiple times throughout the year to watch our children perform in concerts. I was most impressed when my 3 year old, at the time, gave an oral presentation to both students and adults, about penguins. I've seen my daughter blossom both socially and academically. Highly highly recommend!"},{"author":"Jessalyn F.","datePublished":"2016-08-13","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"Children's House Montessori is a small home based preschool modeled closely after Maria Montessori's methods and philosophy of early childhood education.  The school is run by Mrs. Manika who has taken pain staking care to ensure that the children receive an excellent education with authentic Montessori materials, while nurturing and loving them.  As mentioned, the school is run in Mrs. Manika's home.  She has converted her living and dining rooms into a traditional Montessori classroom with all high quality materials displayed on shelves placed at the children's level for easy access.  She also has a small playground area in her backyard for the children to play on, and the children eat snacks and lunch together at their child size table taking turns serving each other and practicing their manners.

During the school year, Mrs. Manika hosts a winter celebration and a graduation party for families, where the children proudly perform songs and skits they have practiced, and share projects that they have made.  She also plans several field trips each year, which the children always enjoy and look forward to.  Over the years we have been to the pumpkin patch, the flower fields, the aquarium, and the Wild Animal Park to name a few. 

Shalini is a caring and loving teacher who nurtures her students.  She not only guides the children to learn the normal preschool fundamentals, but also fosters compassion, acceptance, self-discipline, respect for others and self confidence in her students.  I personally find her easy to approach when I have any questions or concerns.  I also like that she holds parent-teacher conferences each year after the winter break where we can discuss in detail my son's progress, and she has even upon my request, shared suggestions to help my child grow not only in his education, but also emotionally and psychologically.  She is very tuned into each child's personality and uniqueness.  

My experience with Children's House Montessori spans the last 5 years and will continue for the next 4 years until my daughter completes preschool. During my boys' time at Mrs. Manika's school they learned so much and often came home excited, sharing the new things that they had learned.   My oldest son entered Kindergarten very well prepared (especially advanced from the other Kindergarteners in the area of math) and transitioned nicely to elementary school.   I expect the same for my second son when he enters Kindergarten next year.  

I truly can't say enough positive things about our experience with Children's House Montessori or Mrs. Manika."},{"author":"Sharmini R.","datePublished":"2020-06-23","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"My 3-year old has attended Children's House Montessori School for the past 4 months, and we have already observed a big change in her socially and academically. She truly enjoys school and her friends, and her verbal skills have developed rapidly since she's started. She clearly prefers this school to the large daycare she previously attended. The school clearly provides more education and development opportunities than play-based daycares. The teacher, Mrs Manika, is very warm and caring as well, and provides regular updates to parents. I expect my daughter will be well-prepared for kindergarten, and I'm delighted that she has been enjoying preschool so much. Highly recommended!"},{"author":"Mihir S.","datePublished":"2017-02-28","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"Our daughter went to this school for three years. We tried couple of other pre-schools before this one. Other schools were more of a day care/play school rather than a school which focuses on the child's development in social, educational, and personality aspects. Our daughter flourished at this school and graduated with advanced reading and math skills and confidence in herself.

This is a nice home based school run by the able and wonderful teacher Ms. Manika. We cannot say enough good things about her. The kids love and respect her. She is very organized, confident, patient and provides a curriculum true to the Montessori method. The curriculum is advanced but not difficult because it is conducted in a very structured format and catered to each individual student. The props and tools used are genuine Montessori materials. 

Our daughter made some great friends at this school. Our daughter was always very excited to wake up every morning to go to school. It is a great feeling to drop off your kid at school every morning with a big smile on their face.

There are field trips, holiday events and summer graduation parties. At the holiday and graduation parties, the kids perform in a well choreographed play and a few songs.
This is one of the highlights of this school. The kids have so much fun at these events. 

Our daughter is in Kindergarten now. Because of her years at this preschool, she is doing very well in her class. The curriculum at this preschool has helped her to become an advanced learner.
 
Looking back it was one of our best decisions. Honestly we feel blessed to have found this school for our daughter."},{"author":"Cindy C.","datePublished":"2017-02-16","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"I cannot say enough wonderful things about this school and the teacher Mrs. Manika. You will be amazed at the advanced level of reading, math, science, etc your child will achieve here. Two of my children each attended preschool here for 3 years each. It set them up for success for the next several years of school, since due to the progressive learning at preschool, they were advanced for kinder and 1st grade. Your child will definitely benefit from the traditional Montessori material and extremely small, family like classroom. Mrs Manika is kind, patient, organized and disciplined and the children respect and love her. Give your child the head start that will set the stage for years to come by attending this preschool."},{"author":"Ivayla C.","datePublished":"2017-01-29","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"This school is exceptional! I found it on Google Maps and didn't know what to expect. It turned out to be a real gem. It is the first school that offers the right structure and truly lighted my daughter's interest in learning. She is always happy when I pick her up and she loves going to school every day. Mrs. Manika has a very motherly and warm attitude to the kids and besides teaching them various art, science and motor skills, never forgets to teach them values, too. My daughter learned so much about sharing, caring and sympathizing with others, as well as working in a team. There is a small number of kids at the school, so each one gets a lot of personal time and attention from Mrs. Manika. She also helps every kid to integrate in the schoolI and feel accepted and appreciated. I can't be more happy with this school! On top of all this, you don't have to pack lunch, because it is provided. I highly recommend this school!"}],"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingValue":5,"reviewCount":6}}

Ste 2","addressLocality":"Carlsbad","addressCountry":"US","addressRegion":"CA","postalCode":"92008"},"review":[{"author":"Ellen Y.","datePublished":"2019-02-20","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"I took my 8-year-old to Dr. Bloch due to his double vision and blurriness. A complete test with regards to every detail was done by the friendly and helpful staffs and Dr. Bloch, a diagnosis was made.  My son was put on a serious eye muscles exercise for his eyes to work together, and also a training for better reading habit.  The improvement was astonishing!  In just a few weeks, his symptoms were almost gone, and he started developing better reading habit.  His not even complete with the whole program yet, but his reading is already off the chart (some at high school or college level), but his performance in sports also improved.

When I look for any doctor, i care about their medical knowledge, patience to listen and appreciate my concerns and if they are respected by their colleagues and patients.  Dr. Bloch is more than that, he's passionate about what he's doing, and he genuinely cares.  These good qualities also show in the tidiness of his office, and his whole team of staffs.  

My family really appreciates this partnership in this process with Dr. Bloch and his team."},{"author":"Marianne Y.","datePublished":"2018-12-10","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"I was honestly at a standstill with my son. We were at kindergarten reading levels even though he is in 2nd grade. His dyslexia was frustrating for him. Watching my child struggle created so much anxiety for the whole family. I didn't know what to do. A friend told me to see Dr. Bloch. I thought what I have to lose at this point. Dr Bloch has changed my son's life. Within one month he is bringing me chapter books to read. Word recognition, fluency, reading speed, and confidence have improved 100% from where we started. It is an amazing program!"},{"author":"Kristen M.","datePublished":"2019-06-20","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"I found RWL on yelp looking for a reading tutor for my son. I came across Dr. Bloch. 

My son was 10 and had been in tutoring since first grade and was still testing at a 1st grade GLE. I was very frustrated that normal tutoring and learning were not working. My son would come home so disappointed in himself and not wanting to go to school. He had continued to be able to succeed overall in school as most studies were oral or done in group, so individual reading was not a dependency. However, the transition from 5th grade into middle school, I knew he would not be successful if we did not take drastic measures. 

I went through the assessment process with Dr. Bloch. He was able to diagnose areas where my son has physical limitations and his eyes were not tracking words correctly or able to focus as quickly as he should have been. 

I was excited to hear he had helped so many others, so we signed up for the program. At the first session, he was tested to get a base line on his reading level. Then the real work started. Each session thereafter, we performed drills that were designed to teach reading in a completely different method that what my son had been taught in school.

Within the first 4 sessions, my sons confidence had excelled. He was becoming a better reader. By the time the first month passed, we had completed only 7 sessions, but my son was already at 3rd grade levels tested at the school and had received increase scores on his quizzes for language arts.

When we started the program, my son struggled with reading across the board:
1) no interest
2) trouble identifying the words
3) slow reader
4) loss of focus
you name it, he struggled with it.

We are still in the program, but happy to say that he has now tested at almost grade level, which in only 3 short months was able to accomplish what years of tutoring could not.

So if you ask me should you consider this program, absolutely. I would do it again and have already booked future appointments to ensure that my son continues his success.

Thanks Dr. Bloch, we have really appreciated all that you have done for our son!!!"},{"author":"Rebekah H.","datePublished":"2018-08-01","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"My daughter is about to go into fifth grade and has struggled with reading since kindergarten. She always made progress, but the progress was much slower than it should have been - causing her to lag behind several grade levels in reading. Reading has been a chore for her that usually quickly ended in grumbling, whining, or tears. She has worn glasses for years as well, but not until we met with Dr. Bloch, did we realize that her eyes were not tracking properly and they were simply weak. 

 We decided to dedicate this summer to Reading Without Limits, and have just completed two months of the program. My daughter has gone from a first grade reading level, where she was never able to read longer than ten minutes without feeling tension in her head and eyes, to being almost on grade level and reading for over an hour at a time with no strain. She no longer feels tired when she reads, her reading speeds have more than doubled, and she is tracking the words much better. Her confidence has grown tremendously, and she now reads every night before bed because she wants to! We still have a month of the program left, and I am excited to see how much more progress she will make. 

 Dr. Bloch has given her the tools she needed to organize word parts in her mind and the tools she needed to strengthen the muscles in her eyes. I would definitely recommend meeting with Dr. Bloch if your child has struggled with reading. We are most grateful for this program and the research Dr. Bloch has done. I now have a reader on my hands and have literally made two trips to the library this week because she is devouring the books so quickly and WANTS more to read!! The program requires dedication from the child and the parents, but the results have been amazing!"},{"author":"Jk B.","datePublished":"2019-12-04","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"My daughter, who is currently in 5th grade and going to private school, was diagnosed with dyslexia in the second grade.  She has completed the 4th level of the Susan Barton program with limited success.  Because of my daughter's continuing inability to read, my daughter and I have dealt with mounting frustrations, and anxiety: her self-esteem has also taken quite a beating. THANK GOD FOR DR. BLOCH!  We were referred to Dr. Bloch through the public school system's Independent Educational Program (IEP) in the spring of 2019, my daughter started with Dr. Bloch's "Reading With Out Limits" program about 3 months ago.  I can't begin to tell you the incredible reading results that my daughter has achieved under the supervision and training provided by Dr. Bloch through his amazing reading program. Today I am proud to announce that my daughter has quickly accelerated her reading ability from kindergarten to beyond a third grade level of reading, and is more excited and confident than I ever seen her before. Thank you, Dr. Bloch for helping my daughter to learn to read and for her unbridled enthusiasm for reading. I highly recommend this program to children who have been struggling with their reading abilities and their parents who not only want to see measurable improvements in their child's academic performance, but want to see the return of confidence and excitement in their child's young eyes."},{"author":"Kristy F.","datePublished":"2018-06-13","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"My daughter went through Dr Bloch's Reading without limits program a couple of years ago. She came to Dr Bloch's at the end of 3rd grade, a bright kid, but a kid that absolutely hated to read and had extreme difficulty  reading as well as writing legibly. After thorough testing at Dr Bloch's office a diagnosis was made. He started her on a program of exercises that both strengthened her eye muscles and allowed her eyes to work together as they are supposed to, as well as drills to train her brain. The improvement I saw in my daughter happened fast. Within 4 months, she went from refusing to read to enjoying reading and reading at a high school level. She is now in 8 the grade, has been in honors level language arts and history classes for the past 3 years, and is at the top of her class with straight A's and a reading level of a college graduate student. I am so thankful we found Dr Bloch and were able to go through his Reading Without Limits program. I know my daughter's success in school and confidence would not be what it is today had she not gone through this program."},{"author":"Nora N.","datePublished":"2018-06-15","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"We were so happy to find Dr. Block. Our son had been struggling to keep up with his class since he started Kindergarten. By the time he reached 2nd grade he was really struggling. During the testing, we found that our son's eyes weren't tracking and this was a huge issue for him. We knew we had to take action right way. Using Dr. Bloch's techniques we saw immediate improvements. He started without even being able to read the words for eyes tests and he had to read #'s.  Within 2 months, he was already reading at his grade level. He was still slower than the norm but about 4 months later, he caught up and was reading at earlier 3rd grade level books. He still practices and he has learned to love to read. Any parent wants to see the best for their child. This is one thing we've done that we can say has giving him the confidence needed to move through to the next grades. Thank you Dr. Bloch and your team, honestly couldn't have been able to do this without you!"}],"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingValue":5,"reviewCount":7}}
