I cant wait to be back"},{"author":"Elle P.","datePublished":"2018-11-08","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"We have been coming here for years. We love coming to Hands on Pottery to make personalized gifts for family and friends. Great little space, always clean. The owner is so nice and accommodating. We'd recommend this as a great experience for adults and children alike."},{"author":"Coco S.","datePublished":"2017-06-22","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":1},"description":"One and half years ago I attended Hands On Pottery in Fairfield and made a few items with my granddaughter, one of which was a Friends-type large coffee cup.

One morning I was drinking coffee and the handle fell completely off causing the coffee to spill over my Macbook computer destroying it. Not a cheap machine. I had to replace it for $2,000.

I took photos of a rug that was ruined, the cup and my computer and called the company. They hemmed and hawed and offered me a free sitting in their place and nothing more. 

The handle literally broke off from the cup in my hands in thin air. I didn't bump it or do anything to it. It was clearly too small for the size of the cup with the weight of some coffee or it wasn't attached properly.  

For sentimental reasons I kept the cup part and drink from it.  I have put it through the dishwasher many times and it remains standing and just as solvent as day one. Oh, and btw, just got a jumbo coffee cup from Disney about the same size and the handle is about twice the size to accommodate the weight of the cup."},{"author":"Kelsey G.","datePublished":"2019-03-26","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"I do big brothers big sisters and my little and I are always looking for fun activities. Lately she has been into art so we went here. She LOVED it and Has already asked to go back! There were a lot of options of fun things to paint and a lot of colors. The people were very friendly and one of the only places who has ever offered me a discount for BBBS. I didn't even ask for a discount, they were just kind enough to do it. I love doing special activities with my little but it does add up fast so it was very much appreciated! Any place that allows us to be creative is a win in our book, and someone who appreciates a good program like BBBS made my experience even better!"},{"author":"Sara G.","datePublished":"2018-12-15","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"This place is amazing! Wonderful for young kids! So many fun items to pick from to customize. Jim and his staff are so extremely helpful!!"},{"author":"Tanner M.","datePublished":"2015-08-08","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":4},"description":"I'm not an artsy type but went here today with the gf and her cousin and we had a good experience. The staff was very helpful and professional, and it was a fun thing. Only knock I have is it seems expensive. Then again I'm not artsy like I said so maybe the masterpiece I created will one day be worth more than what we paid"},{"author":"Matt And Cathy G.","datePublished":"2013-07-15","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"What a great way for four kids ranging from 9 to 14 to all have a great time! They truly get to create and be inspired! The employees are professional, helpful and so patient. They make the kids feel great and give such good feedback to make sure they will be happy with their finished product.

While somewhat pricey, studio time + cost of item chosen, and a 3-4 day wait to pick up your finished product, it was well worth the investment if money and time. The kids are delighted and all chose things they actually are using (NOT JUST BANKS!)--switch plates, mug, keepsake box and post it note holder this time...I have a great kitchen collection of napkin holder, spoon rests and salt/pepper shakers too!

Pure FUN!"},{"author":"Sujatha H.","datePublished":"2009-07-09","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"Hands On Pottery is great for everyone. I prefer this location to the one in Darien, it's a bit more open and I didn't feel as cramped.  It can get pricey very fast, especially with lots of people but the end result is awesome.  I work with kids and have had them make presents for theirs parents here numerous times and they are always a huge hit.  

The staff is always super accommodating and very friendly offering advice and tips.  At this location and the Darien one all of the staff members I have encountered have been extremely patient and understanding with children with is a super plus."},{"author":"Mr B.","datePublished":"2010-10-26","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":4},"description":"Fun for all ages, great personalized gifts, and qualified staff to help monitor complexity of project - as well as mess that comes with it."},{"author":"Kori R.","datePublished":"2016-10-17","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":3},"description":"This is tough because I love this concept, have mostly encountered nice people working here, and I once met the owner who was super friendly and had great energy, but recently I was there for a child's birthday party and one of the employees is clearly in the wrong business.  She was in charge of running the party but I'm pretty sure she doesn't like kids.  She didn't smile once, acted like everyone there was in her way, and rudely shushed the children when they were chanting in excitement over cake.  Is this a library or an art studio that hosts child's bday parties?!  I watched her be rude and unfriendly to outside customers picking up their pottery as well.  After reading another review it seems the owners really need to be more careful with who they hire.  If I were the paying mom of the party I would've been furious that that's who I got.  Try being a little pleasant if you're going to take a job that interacts with kids.  The second girl working may have been a nice girl but I can't say for sure, she stood silently waiting for something to do most of the time.  Probably afraid to get in the way of the wicked witch."},{"author":"Mark C.","datePublished":"2015-03-15","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":1},"description":"We received a gift certificate for this place and thought it would be a great way for our two children to do some fun crafting on a cold wintery day. When we arrived it was very confusing, not much in the way of direction from anyone that worked there. They were having a birthday party in the back and clearly that was the priority. We wandered around with the rest of the clueless parents for someone to actually explain to us the way things work. After picking out the pottery we then went up to pick out paint colors, which was also very disorganized.  There was no explanation of what was available to us, we had to wander around and find stencils and stamps only after seeing other people using them. All of the brushes have seen their day, and there were no new ones to be found. And then after cashing out we find out that not only do you pay for each pottery piece but there is an additional "studio fee" of  $8 per person per hour, for a total of over $100.00. Although it is a great concept, I will not be back due to the lack of help from the staff and the cost."},{"author":"mara g.","datePublished":"2013-07-16","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"I'm 43, and I thought this was a fantastic activity.  The sky's the limit in terms of creativity potential, they play great music, and it's a relaxing atmosphere.  I agree with one critic who said the brushes could use a little updating, but apart from that, it's a fabulous indoor activity."},{"author":"Amy K.","datePublished":"2013-04-14","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":1},"description":"So disappointed!  I used to love Hands on Pottery, but just had the worst experience.  The brushes were so old and frayed they would not paint properly and the squeeze tubes full of glopy paint. {"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"LocalBusiness","name":"The Goddard School","image":"https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/r5CEVmz_U_iUtMhE52WCag/l.jpg","telephone":"(859) 331-8400","address":{"streetAddress":"205 Grandview Dr","addressLocality":"Fort Mitchell","addressCountry":"US","addressRegion":"KY","postalCode":"41017"},"review":[{"author":"Shawn E.","datePublished":"2019-10-13","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"I knew we chose the right daycare facility when my son had his first febrile seizure on a Sunday. I notified the school after my son missed several days of school of his diagnosis. Juliana called me the first day he was back. She implemented a protocol that if he ever had a fever, they would give him Tylenol (with a doctor's note) and that a parent would have to pick him up right away. \n\nThis past Friday, my son's teacher Ms. Didi noticed his fever right away (even though it was only 99.5) and the school notified me. I arrived to pick him up within about 20 minutes. As I was putting him in his car seat he had another febrile seizure and started to turn blue. I ran him back inside and Gabbi very calmly called 911. The paramedics arrived within minutes. Meanwhile several teachers came to help apply ice and comfort the both of us. Gabbi offered to come with us to the hospital and without my insisting we were fine, would have. Gabbi even texted us to check in with our family later that night. I cannot thank the staff at Goddard Ft. Mitchell enough for their compassion and help in such a difficult moment."},{"author":"Sean B.","datePublished":"2010-01-19","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"We researched dozens of daycare options in the Cincinnati area and nothing came close to the Goddard School. {"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"LocalBusiness","name":"Kids Plus Child Development Center","image":"https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/aziAlYEvZYkReXcjmIFrJg/l.jpg","telephone":"(251) 970-1566","address":{"streetAddress":"900 S Bay St","addressLocality":"Foley","addressCountry":"US","addressRegion":"AL","postalCode":"36535"},"review":[{"author":"Lynn D.","datePublished":"2015-02-06","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"They must be good....the past 2 mornings my husband has came home disappointed & heartbroken because our grandson Kayson didn't cry to stay with his peepaw... when I pick him up he is always happy...and that's my heart"},{"author":"H M.","datePublished":"2012-08-16","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":1},"description":"Dont take your kids here!  I dropped my kids off and went to pick them up on thier first day and saw my 1 year old daughter's teacher jerking on another childs arm, very aggressively.  I was in shock.  I pulled my kids immediately.  Management said they "talked" to the employee.  I can not allow my children to be somewhere that abuses children.  I am sure it wasnt the first time that the employee did it, and due to managements lack of action, it wont be the last."},{"author":"Amanda M.","datePublished":"2012-09-12","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"I cannot speak for the previous reviews, however, I cannot imagine any of that going on at Kid Plus. I have been taking my kids there for 3 years and they love it. My first born started as a baby, and my other child started at 6 weeks old. The staff is incredibly helpful and takes the time to get to know each child and their needs. I get a hand written report daily that lets me know what times their diapers were changed, how long they napped, and what they ate. Sometimes when I come to pick my kids up they don't even want to leave because they are too busy playing with the other kids and the teachers. They have excellent playing areas. The "big kid" playground has plenty of jungle gyms, swings, bikes, etc. as well as a lot of grass for them to run around and play tag. The teachers are always out there playing with them games such as duck duck goose, and red rover. The little kid playground has lots of smaller toys for the toddlers and the teachers are always pushing the babies in the swings. The meals are included in your tuition and my son always talks about how good the food is. He especially loves when they have corn dog nuggets. The center even has a K-4 program that my son will be starting next year that I am so excited for. Overall, I have seen a huge difference in my children compared to other peoples children who do not go to Kid Plus. My children are far more advanced due to the hardwork and dedication the teachers put into each child. They don't just sit them down in front of a TV or send them to the playground to do whatever they want. Every day is structured with a schedule which helps us out at home because my son has a routine, which helps his behavior out a lot. The teachers always do crafts as well, my fridge is covered in a million different pictures my kids have done over the years. They always bring home sweet little poems with handprints for mothers/fathers day. The teachers also try to have parties for the different holidays and nothing makes my kids happier than bringing cupcakes to school and getting to share them with their friends. I would reccommend Kid Plus to every parent out there. I could not imagine having a better day care facility to take my kids to. In fact, I will be sad when my oldest has to leave day care to go to the elementary school. I will probably leave him in their after school program so I can pick up both my children at once."}],"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingValue":3.5,"reviewCount":3}}

{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"LocalBusiness","name":"Columbia Southern University","image":"https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/H9QJrecu74JlRjQpAJfNrA/l.jpg","telephone":"(251) 981-3771","address":{"streetAddress":"21982 University Ln","addressLocality":"Orange Beach","addressCountry":"US","addressRegion":"AL","postalCode":"36561"},"review":[{"author":"Kathleen A.","datePublished":"2019-09-18","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"CSU offers a variety of degrees and truly provides support all along the way. I was fortunate enough to get my MS in Occupational Healy & Safety from this wonderful inst. All classes were online and any time I had a question, there was someone on the other end of the phone to help walk me through things. Shout out to my former advisor Luke who always took time to answer my questions. 

 Not only does the curriculum and advising get five stars but so does graduation! It's a pretty awesome event where students from all over the world come together to celebrate.

Additionally, with respect to Safety degrees and careers, this school always represents at conferences and conventions in the industry. I know I can stop by their exhibitor booth and say hi. Everyone is friendly and helpful and they always put together great networking events to help current students and alumni meet other people in the field. Paul and Ernie- you are both awesome to say hello to during NSC and ASSP conferences.

How could I almost forget about graduation?!? People from all over the world coming together to celebrate. The staff put on an amazing event and I met some people that I am still friends with! Definitely a must when you finish your degree. Make the weekend into a fun beach vacation to celebrate.

If you are on the fence in deciding whether or not to further your education at CSU, I can tell you that my experience was amazing and I will go back when I am ready to get another degree!"},{"author":"Youknow M.","datePublished":"2022-01-21","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"Hi everybody! In my forties I thought it was too late to go back, I was so wrong, and glad that I did.  Online schooling is a challenge as one needs to think outside the box and sometimes be a mind reader of what their professors might be looking for.  I recieved both my BS and MBA at Columbia Southern University and learned confidence in areas and schools of thought that I did not have before.  The courses will challenge you and the college is at a great price.  And before any of you go running away at the challenge, remember that the challenge is what you learn from and need to overcome.  In many of the programs you will learn more than your education, and will find a staff that has your success in mind.  The extra things I learned were patience, professionalism, and the courage to seek clarity like a pro and within academic policies and chains of command.  They are flexible and even had life flexible terms that you can choose from.  Although only a nationally accredited institution and a member of the Distance Education and Training Council, they are as of 2022 under review for being regionally accredited. 
 They also have an alumni association that students can be recommended to.  Check them out.  Good luck to all of you on your degree pursuits, and good luck to CSU on becoming regionally accredited.  ~Sincerely, a CSU Knight Ambassador."},{"author":"Donna S.","datePublished":"2021-08-29","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"Great experience with this school. Consistently well-structured courses and support."},{"author":"Dru T.","datePublished":"2018-05-27","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":3},"description":"Affordable tuition, excellent teachers and staff, very willing to work with your schedule to help you succeed.  MILITARY FRIENDLY to the max.  I really hope they get Regional Accreditation soon so their credits will transfer and be recognized at a higher level.  They are currently Nationally Accredited by the DEAC, the same accreditation as the "free" college, University of the People.  I put quotes around free because at UoP, the online courses are free but the final exams are $100 to take and receive credit for the course. 

From what I was told by my advisor at CSU, they are working diligently towards a Regional Accreditation sometime in the near future.

Once that is achieved I will highly recommend this school. In the meantime, I can definitely say I like their platform and I like where they are going!"},{"author":"Blanca G.","datePublished":"2019-11-15","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":1},"description":"My only regret is not looking into this doctoral program before I signed up for it. But some of the professors need to work on their people skills."},{"author":"James C.","datePublished":"2012-08-04","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":4},"description":"I received my bachelor's degree from here.  I think High School had a harder curriculum.  The chewbacca defense works when submitting essays to about 90% of the staff here.  If you want an easily attainable nationally accredited degree without having to exert basically any effort then this is your place.  Its pretty expensive too, but I don't mind.  The American Taxpayer paid my tuition!"},{"author":"Caren O.","datePublished":"2012-07-12","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"Great online university! Flexible hours and exceptional student services!"},{"author":"Shaun F.","datePublished":"2015-03-19","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"Columbia Southern University is an excellent university. I have to disagree with the person who said that this college is as easy as or easier than high school. Yes, most of the work you submit is essays; however, that is the challenging part.  The coursework is very rigorous. I have attended both a b&m college as well as CSU, so I can attest that this college is definitely harder. You can't plagiarize essays because they use Turn It In for many of the classes and major points are deducted if the redundancy rate is too high. I have had this happen, even when none of my material was plagiarized. So, I had to learn to use more of my own words and and not quote so much material. If you can easily write essays, you might consider this university easy. However, if you struggle with writing and thoughts don't come as easily to you, like me, then you might have a different view of this school. In one class alone, I had to write 18 essays. It would be much easier to have multiple choice, like I did in high school or like I did when I went to my b&m college.  However, I will say that I have retained more information through my coursework at CSU than I have at any other school. I retain more information when I have to write than when I have to just memorize information for a short term. There is no extra credit or making up assignments. If you don't do the work, you will not get a good grade. I would recommend this university to any working adult who does not have time to go to college the traditional way. If you enjoy independent learning and don't have to be in a classroom,  you will like CSU.  I am a senior at CSU, graduating this year. I do not feel like my degree is being handed to me; I have worked hard for the degree that I will receive. This journey has been more time consuming and stressful than I could have ever imagined, but well worth it!"}],"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingValue":4,"reviewCount":20}}

{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"LocalBusiness","name":"Cradle 2 Crayons","image":"https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/zUIgIvsOH-BFiJZjUDjvxg/l.jpg","telephone":"(251) 943-4599","address":{"streetAddress":"507 W Rose Ave","addressLocality":"Foley","addressCountry":"US","addressRegion":"AL","postalCode":"36535"},"review":[{"author":"Brandy C.","datePublished":"2016-04-13","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":1},"description":"I was unimpressed with how my children were taken care of. {"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"LocalBusiness","name":"Accademia del Giglio","telephone":"055 2302467","address":{"streetAddress":"Via Ghibellina, 116","addressLocality":"Florence","addressCountry":"IT","addressRegion":"FI","postalCode":"50122"},"review":[{"author":"Blue K.","datePublished":"2016-10-14","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":2},"description":"I studied at this school for a good chunk of time while living in Florence, and your personal experience can vary a lot here - mine was not so great.  They offer studies in the fine arts and in the Italian language, and I only studied art, so I have no idea how the Italian education was.  The school's art 'curriculum' is very misleading, seeing as they actually have none, and a lot of the 'subjects' they supposedly had only exist if you bring it up to the teacher yourself.  I think that the only redeeming quality about the school was the very dedicated teacher at the time, who was very knowledgable, pushed his students to do better, and clearly loved art.  Two out of three of the people who run the school didn't seem to care very much about the students nor their experience at the school, which is probably why some students were unhappy with the structure of the school if they were studying there long-term.  I'm not sure who the main art teacher is right now.  This very tiny school is a good option if you want a very simple and basic experience in Florence and in the arts, because you do get a lot of freedom to just study whatever you feel like doing.  In that case it's really nice, and a great option for people who want to learn art basics!  Also, they'll provide very, very basic art supplies if you need them.  However, I would not recommend staying there longer than 3 months at the most -- any more than that would be repetitive and the certificate in the fine arts that they offer doesn't seem to be very official.  If you want a long-term study look into another school or even better, a university!  So to summarize, good for less than three months of study, and think about what you want for your school experience."}],"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingValue":3,"reviewCount":2}}

{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"LocalBusiness","name":"Europass","image":"https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/vx7ATVANTotUw60eUH74sw/l.jpg","telephone":"055 2345802","address":{"streetAddress":"Via Sant'Egidio 12","addressLocality":"Florence","addressCountry":"IT","addressRegion":"FI","postalCode":"50122"},"review":[{"author":"Maria A.","datePublished":"2016-11-02","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":4},"description":"The school is located in a central area and the teachers are nice and well prepared. Unfortunately they only told me that they didn't have a course on my level two days before my arrival, so instead of a C1, I'm doing two hours of a B2 and two hours of a A2 course. This is annoying, but at least the director was nice and offered me a cooking course as a compensation, so I am overall relatively happy."},{"author":"Dana S.","datePublished":"2014-12-10","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":4},"description":"I spent a lot of time to choose the school and it's a really good choice. Everything here is nice. Especially Tatiana and Maurisio - they are great! Thank a lot! After 2 weeks i've felt the progress. I definitely could recommended this school for those who want to improve their oral skills and who want after school have a nice walk in centro storico."},{"author":"Cathy V.","datePublished":"2015-05-22","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":4},"description":"What I like very much of Europass, is that I had a conversation from the start just so we could see in which class I could start. Because I studied Italian before, I didn't want to learn the language from the very beginning. This way I could start at my own level, together with students who where as far as I was. It wasn't hard for me to get along with the other students, because they would make the same errors as I did. I was in a class with Rafaella and she is very sympathetic. She includes everyone and even though we only spoke Italian, she made everything very clear.  If someone makes a mistake, she takes the time to explain. This also makes lessons very intense. One lesson, that takes about four hours, can maybe consist of only the grammar of one aspect. We could talk about irregular verbs and tenses very extensively. Because of this I wished I could follow the course longer than two weeks, because not everything of my level, B1, could be covered. But for me, because I study Italian at home, it gives me the opportunity to ask questions whenever I do not understand something. I like the fact that there is enough room to make mistakes, I didn't feel 'stupid' at any time.  Rafaella will help you if you have a hard time putting sentences together. \n\nPractically: the school has a great location, in the heart of the centre. It is nice to walk to town when lessons are over. Also the school doesn't feel very 'crowded'. Its groups are small. When you are alone, the school provides tours with a guide and cooking lessons and aperitivi, which are great to do if you don't know the city and you want someone to tell you where you should go ;-) I really felt like the teachers and the staff in general know what they are doing, making everyone as comfortable as possible. And if you want to explore the city by yourself, it's also fine."}],"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingValue":4,"reviewCount":3}}

{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"LocalBusiness","name":"Polimoda","image":"https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/D_5qgZlCuBUcf0tUyO0qwg/l.jpg","telephone":"055 275061","address":{"streetAddress":"Via Curtatone","addressLocality":"Florence","addressCountry":"IT","addressRegion":"FI","postalCode":"50123"},"review":[{"author":"Joanna T.","datePublished":"2015-02-02","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":4},"description":"A beautiful location on the banks of the Arno River. This international institute for fashion design and marketing is owned by the Ferragamo family. It sits right next to the American embassy and has lovely architecture. A woman I met suggested I take a peek since I was interested in learning about fashion here in Firenze.
There are two buildings in the Villa. The one with the information and administrative offices has gorgeous murals and decorative walls; even a hall of mirrors!
Incredible tiny green park and a terrace space for the students to relax in.
This is certainly an inspiring place to be exposed to fashion design. An international student body makes for varied perspective on designing fashion.
Got some information to share with others back home.
Nice to have seen the interior with the ornate classrooms and beautiful setting."}],"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingValue":4,"reviewCount":1}}

{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"LocalBusiness","name":"Alabama State College of Barber Styling","telephone":"(205) 631-8898","address":{"streetAddress":"753 Main St","addressLocality":"Gardendale","addressCountry":"US","addressRegion":"AL","postalCode":"35071"},"review":[]}

{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"LocalBusiness","name":"Scuola Toscana","image":"https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/I1c5Psttfs9ULayyj_VjTQ/l.jpg","telephone":"055 244583","address":{"streetAddress":"Via dei Benci 23","addressLocality":"Florence","addressCountry":"IT","addressRegion":"FI","postalCode":"50122"},"review":[{"author":"Seiji C.","datePublished":"2016-08-14","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"I spent July in Tuscany going to school at La Scuola Toscana, a school that provides not only great education of a beautiful world language, but also of a rich culture.

First off, I should let you know that I am not a beginner in my travels or in my personal education, and that I come from the US where we have incredible customer service.  I am also an educator. I must say that this administration, as far as European administration goes, is superior in its customer service.  They are sensitive, efficient, and genuinely kind even to difficult students.  Specifically, there was a clerical error with my tuition. I was panicked as I didn't speak the language fluently and realized how difficult this situation could be.  Fortunately I saved all the necessary documents (as one should) showing that I had already payed.  As I approached the desk asking about the notification, documents in hand and ready to 'prove' my case, the director simply stated that he was sorry, and that it was a filing error on their end, and there was nothing to worry about.  No questions, no proof needed, and nothing but smiles and relief on their end. 

Also they have a 'welcome' package all ready for their new students.  It's full of little tidbits that will help you get through the first few weeks on your own. So thoughtful!  They make you feel welcome, are very sensitive to any anxieties you may have about being there, and can manage different levels of fluency in Italian seeing as the administration speaks a great deal of other languages fluently. (I personally witnessed, not only English, but Japanese, Spanish and Hungarian.) 

Secondly, the scaffolding of the educational system is very well done.  There were classes for beginners of all levels, intermediate studiers, and even for those who wanted to master the language.  Outside of grammer and conversation, are myriad classes to take, I chose the COOKING class with Signora Fiammetti. I have to say that this cooking course was far superior to any of the cooking courses I attempted to take in France.  When I tried to do my research to find a place in France to do this, I found that either the prices were outrageous OR the skill level of the educators in the kitched were disappointing either in the language pedagogy OR in the skills/products used or made in the kitchen.  Neither of these were true about the cooking course I took.  Signora Fiammetti is a professionally trained chef/caterer, raised in Tuscany/Italy and trained in Paris.  Her organization was unbeatable, exceptionally well paced, and her tips on cooking were among the top I have ever seen.  I am no stranger to the kitchen, but she was able to give me a very wide range of tips, even on the basics of cutting an onion, or tearing basil.  The 4 course meals we prepared were unbelievable in the subtleties of flavors and the colorful presentation of food.  If you are a lover of food and cooking, I highly HIGHLY recommend this as an option.  I also have to say that our course had about 3-4 people in it, and of different levels of fluency in Italian. No matter!  We still spoke whatever level of italian we were equipped with, and her patience and teaching skills still helped us learn while we were cooking!  Incredible!

Lastly,  the teachers were so well adapted for their subject matter.  One member of my family was in the beginners level, while I found myself in the advanced group.  The instructors for beginners had, for people just getting used to the language,  teachers with an unparalleled amount of patience, kindness, organization and genuinity.  The advanced group had teachers that were of university-level brilliance in their subject matter (literature, language, etc.) and while at times their pedagogy seemed unfamiliar, I found myself challenged not only on a linguistic level, but an intellectual level as well. The extra tours with Caterina were fantastic!!!

Areas of improvement:  

Air conditioning:  During the hot months (and I imagine the same of the cold months) the lack of air conditioning made the learning particularly difficult for everyone in the class.  

Pedagogy (differentiated instruction for different groups taught) schoolwide is probably needed on a small level.  Therefore it might be a good idea for the administration to sit in on all classes from time to time to comment on style of instruction and just to provide feedback.  Also, perhaps all the teachers get together periodically to discuss methods. I feel that it would improve the solidarity of the school and increase the available methodologies of instruction between teachers. Strengths of each teacher can benefit the entire school in this way.

In summary, I would easily go back to this school.  The school is unbelievably rewarding for anyone wanting to learn about not just Tuscany, but Italy in general!  Put this on your list!"},{"author":"John S.","datePublished":"2015-04-26","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"Hi guys, I were in Florence attendino a 2 week course, everyday Italian classes in the morning and every afternoon an activity (as you mention in your question): monday we went discovering the secrets in Florence, tuesday we had a cooking class, wednesday a Chianti tour and Farm visit, thursday we went shopping, then the Uffizi Gallery..great! We attended Scuola Toscana - it is located close to Piazza Santa Croce, something like  benci street. Very nice teachers, friendly atmosphere...what else? Ticket included. Do not forget my most important recommendation: do not sit in Piazza Repubblica to drink a cappuccino...10 dollars! 
Your John!"}],"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingValue":5,"reviewCount":2}}

{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"LocalBusiness","name":"Historical Powell School","image":"https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/R_S0ljaXn1aNSt0NhALvyA/l.jpg","telephone":"","address":{"streetAddress":"6TH And 24th","addressLocality":"Birmingham","addressCountry":"US","addressRegion":"AL","postalCode":"35233"},"review":[{"author":"Melissa B.","datePublished":"2014-03-11","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"On Saturday, March 8th, Tony and I was walking around downtown Birmingham checking out all of the old gorgeous buildings. We ran across this magnificent example of Victorian Architecture and the oldest school still standing in Birmingham.

Found this article about it:
The timing probably couldn't be better for the "for sale" to go up on historic Powell School.

Powell, Birmingham's oldest school, at 124 years old, was heavily damaged in a fire in January 2011. At first, thoughts were that the building would have to be razed, a significant loss to the city's history.
But the city of Birmingham wisely struck a deal with the Alabama Trust for Historic Preservation to control the building and see whether it can be saved.
So far, the news has been good. The Alabama Trust for Historic Preservation has cleaned up most of the fire damage and is continuing with plans to put a roof back on Powell to protect the structure from the elements and to stabilize the building's outer walls.

A February 5, 1970 article in the Birmingham Public Library Archives tells us that the Powell Elementary School is Birmingham's oldest school, dating back to 1874, having been founded immediately after the cholera epidemic swept the town, practically depopulating it. Woodlawn, Henley and Powell were known as the oldest white public schools in Birmingham, the others having been built after 1900.Actually, the school that occupied the site of the old Powell School that burned yesterday, was called The Free White School, and a picture of it appears in another article featured in the Birmingham City Archives' digital collection. 

HISTORICAL MARKER READS:
Birmingham's first public school was named for Colonel James R. Powell, the city's first elected Mayor. This energetic promoter also served as the first President of the Elyton Land Company (now Birmingham Realty). which founded the city in 1871. Two years later, Colonel John T. Terry led the fund raising to establish a "free school for white children." The school was "free" only of ties to a religious institution for fees were charged according to grade level. Mayor Powell donated his salary, police court fines and other city fees to support the school.
The present red brick Victorian Gothic style structure, designed by S. J. Hall of Cleveland, Ohio in 1888, is the third Powell School. Until 1918, the school accommodated grades one through twelve and for a time served as a training school for prospective teachers"}],"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingValue":5,"reviewCount":1}}

I would consider giving this establishment a second chance, but unlike them, I take childcare seriously."},{"author":"C J.","datePublished":"2015-04-23","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"Our son has been going to Bright Beginnings since he was four months old and we could not be more pleased with his level of care there. Days are structured, food is good, any issues are swiftly dealt with, and he absolutely adores his caregivers. 

We looked at several other daycare providers and Bright Beginnings was the obvious choice."},{"author":"Meagan H.","datePublished":"2015-06-25","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":1},"description":"Apparently Bright Beginnings does not acknowledge unique parenting situations.

My stepson attends Bright Beginnings, due to the wishes of his biological mother; I often drop him off and pick him up. Recently, after checking him out at the door and being informed that there was a message at the desk, I checked in with the receptionist to see what had happened. 

She informed me there was an incident report but refused to let me see it, read it, or sign it, despite the fact that I have signed three separate reports in the past. The receptionist said that they prefer the child's "real parents" provide a signature.

I have been a part of my stepson's life since he was only a few months old. This incident was an insult and was beyond disrespectful to me and my role in his life.

Not only that, but several times, upon picking him up, he has had a soiled diaper caked onto him. Of course, this always results in horrendous diaper rash and is extremely painful for him.

Save yourself the trouble and find another childcare situation for your children."},{"author":"Mekayla T.","datePublished":"2015-11-24","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":1},"description":"My 1 1/2 year old daughter has been going here for less than 2 months. It's over priced, the staff was extremely rude, and so far she has been neglected and ignored. Two weeks ago she had a severe double ear infection (with no call to me about her symptoms), when I walked in to pick her up at the end of the day, her hair was matted to her tears, her nose was running into her mouth, and she was screaming while sitting on the floor with a teacher standing by doing paperwork. Last week I had to take a day off because she had contracted pink eye. Now today I was phoned at work to find out she had "tripped" and she has 2 chipped teeth. I chose a center over a private home for safety issues and this is NOT what I paid extra for! Her clothes are always stained, she's always very hungry when she is picked up and I've had to call into work 3 times now, add that to what I've spent in Dr's visits and medication..."},{"author":"Jenny S.","datePublished":"2014-06-27","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"Bright Beginnings recently moved to family style dining where the kids serve themselves and pass the shared dish to a friend. My daughter eats more since she has some control and knows how to control her portions. Others have commented on how well she does at the dinner table as well."},{"author":"Jason B.","datePublished":"2017-05-11","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":1},"description":"DO NOT TAKE YOUR CHILD HERE -Total lack of structure and supervision - my child is a very outgoing person and always makes new friends - He was scared every day going to this place - he would be crying every day we picked him up and when we asked him about the "adults/caretakers" and what they did for the day, he would just start crying again and not want to say anything - Also be warned, they dont tell you that you have to give a written notice if you plan on leaving - Apparently it is lost somewhere in the fine print of the application but do they tell you about it? NO - The last month we paid for, my child never even went - Now I get it we paid for that month so I didn't expect anything back - However, we were then charged for another month because we didn't give written notice - On top of that, we were never notified of the charge and they sent us to collections 6 months later - When I called them I was told that it wasnt their problem and they called us - I would NEVER recommend you take your child to this establishment"}],"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingValue":2.5,"reviewCount":9}}

Without the help of Dr. Park, taking numerous AP classes in addition to participating in sports and other after-school activities, all while maintaining a good academic performance would not have been possible. Overall, the academy greatly helped me stay on schedule with school (all throughout high school!), test prep (ACT, SAT, other school tests), applying to colleges, and scholarships."},{"author":"Dahyon K.","datePublished":"2014-10-02","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"When I was in high school preparing for the SATs, I prepped with this company. 

The academy's college prep program was a great help to me and with it, I was able to get into the colleges I aimed to get into. Despite helping you with SATs, they also were able to help me and give me ideas on how to apply to colleges. The academy wants to help you get into the college that you want to get into and truly care for your education. 

Although I did not end up attending my top choice colleges due to their high tuition fees and not enough scholarships, I was able to get a very good financial aid packet at Creighton University with a 2-4 Pharmacy program which allowed me to be closer to my goals of going to Pharmacy School. 

I truly recommend this company. Without their SAT prep class, I don't think I would've been able to get into the college of my choice or get a good scholarship. They stress a good education and prepare you to become a successful person inside and outside of school."},{"author":"JD C.","datePublished":"2013-04-11","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"I prepped with this company back in the early days before it was a bigger company, and now I tutor here.  It's great to see growth.  I'm going to give an un-biased report:

I scored around a 2300 through prepping here, back when the "new" SAT was new.  I took the SAT once on my own and prepped through 2 more SATs here, and after prepping with them, obtained a perfect score on the Writing.  I also ACT-prepped here twice and got a 34 (out of 36).

The Academy helped plan my academic path early on and naturally, I used their college prep services, and got into Columbia University, University of Chicago, Northwestern, Georgetown, etc (oddly enough, I was waitlisted at University of Washington in St. Louis, though lol).  It came down to Columbia and Northwestern, but I ended up going to NU.

One thing I must emphasize about their college prep program is that it is truly comprehensive.  Like, they help you from A to Z and beyond.  Their philosophy is "Let me help you get your kid into his/her Harvard," but they don't stop there.  They aggressively focus on scholarships.  I got a full ride merit-scholarship into Northwestern (whereas, ivy league schools don't usually give scholarships but are great with financial aid if you need a lot of it).  So, at first, I was a bit sad not to go to Columbia, but in the end and looking back, I was really pleased that I walked out of college debt-free AND got a stellar education.
(P.S.- back in the day, Columbia was ranked #9 and Northwestern was #11, so it made little difference ranking-wise where I chose to go.  In 2013, Columbia is at #4).

So, even though I may SOUND biased, I mean, I did walk out with fantastically improved scores, a fantastic college prep package, and got into my absolute top choice schools.  I got results--and not just any, but the ones I wanted.
I am not writing this because I work here, or because I was asked to.  I try to be a very honest person in life, and I would never have chosen to work here if I didn't think their services or philosophy was up to par.  The truth is, I decided to teach here because I agree with the philosophy and practices.  They truly care about education and each student.  I've seen the founders help less privileged students by writing off hours and giving them scholarships, and I saw them do this before the company became bigger--usually the time of initial "company growth" is not the time most business people act so generous.  They're not in it for the money, they're in it because education makes the world a better place.  Their kids both went to phenomenal undergraduate and graduate programs but are working/will be working in the public service sector.

Trust me, and not just because I work here (though, it should encourage you to come, as I did score in the 99% and am one of their best tutors), if you are passionate about your education and being/becoming successful, you want to be here.  There is no other place you'd personally want to be, or send your kid.  I'll be using their services again for graduate school entrance prep."}],"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingValue":5,"reviewCount":4}}

{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"LocalBusiness","name":"Giggles Drop In Childcare","image":"https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/9swRT6rohJwlNWC87UpAcA/l.jpg","telephone":"(864) 991-8561","address":{"streetAddress":"10 W Lewis Plz","addressLocality":"Greenville","addressCountry":"US","addressRegion":"SC","postalCode":"29605"},"review":[{"author":"Jason H.","datePublished":"2017-12-07","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"This is an awesome addition in Greenville area and it would help a lot of parents to have a place to drop off their kid(s) anytime in the morning, afternoon, or evening. They are normally open until 10pm (DATE NIGHT ANYONE?) 

Our son, 2, had his first daycare experience here and he had a blast, was well behaved, and the staff were accommodating.

The staff especially the area director, Paula were extremely friendly and shared details of our son's day. Since it was his first experience, we would call every other hour and they assured that our son is having a lot of fun and he looked so happy when we came to get him. 

The people are amazing and the place is neat, obviously being new as they recently opened on 12/1. This is a big bonus for parents that need a break to do adulting and there's no reservations required. They have several plans that can put your kid there as low as $9 to $11 a hour, exactly what you would probably pay for a sitter minus a fun place for kids to play with other kids.

Definitely looking forward to returning soon! #GVLAPPROVED"},{"author":"Sarah L.","datePublished":"2018-03-17","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"It's just as great as you've dreamed-a place to leave your kids for an hour or three while you go to the doctor's appointment or grocery store. I'm new to Greenville and left all of my family and friends in Florida. We have twin 2 year olds and a 5 year old. Have you ever tried herding cats? We struggle to get in the car, let alone navigate the tempting aisles of Target. Giggles has been a Godsend. Paula has been nothing but professional, polite, and sincere. She and the other staff members take their time to learn each child's preferences and personalities. My kids love going which makes my life so much easier. 

***My son has a medical condition and food allergies and they have been accommodating and warm. If you have a child with food allergies, you understand how scary it is to trust them in the care of others. I know he's safe and my sanity is in tact. 

Very thankful! See you guys tomorrow!!"},{"author":"Lindsey S.","datePublished":"2018-02-19","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":1},"description":"Being new to the area and without family here for support and a traveling husband,  Giggles was supposed to be a solution for me to be able to take an hour here and there to accomplish some things without my toddler. I read every review and felt really comfortable and excited to take my daughter there for her very first time in a daycare situation. She has been involved in many activities with other children and babies, but I've always been there, so I was nervous,  especially being a first time mom, but I decided it was time to give it a try and trust someone else with my child. I was initially turned off, because no one introduced themselves or even acknowledged my presence other than the person who checked me in. She was there for an hour and a half while I went to an appointment.  When I arrived to pick her up, she looked more upset than I'd ever seen her, but I assumed she was getting tired and that she was just upset because I wasn't there. I was told that the hour and a half had "ups and downs" but that she did pretty well overall and was finally playing happily by the time I got back. Unfortunately, as I was buckling her into her car seat,  I noticed that she had blood in her nostrils,  a fat upper lip, and red marks on her forehead.  I went back in and asked if she had fallen. First she said that she hadn't fallen, but then I showed her the injuries, and the story changed to, "oh yea, she fell off of the bench of the picnic table not long after you left, but I didn't see any blood. Do you want me to clean it up? ". Then I was told that next time, I should take her in the morning when it's not so busy and when there are more kids her age and that since it was President's Day, it was an extra busy day. So this was somehow my fault? Why should that matter? If you can't accommodate a 1 year old safely,  change the age requirements.  Honestly,  if someone would have even told me that she fell, I wouldn't be as upset. Accidents happen.  She's fallen a hundred times at home. I get it. What I don't get is why no one told me and why the story changed from one second to the next. You should also change your policies and regulations information, because you don't actually notify anyone of accidents. This first daycare experience just validated all of my fears, and I won't be back, and my mom friends won't be either. It's really disappointing, especially since I've already purchased a groupon for myself and friend, but the money isn't important.  I'd pay double if I could trust them. I honestly feel really terrible that I have to be the first negative review,  but a fat lip for my baby is a fat lip for your business.  I'd suggest you be up front next time instead of hoping someone doesn't notice the injuries.

Update 

At 3:34 PM on February 20, 2018, the director of Giggles called me. She said she was calling to check on Eleanor after her fall. I told her that I thought she was fine and told her about the marks under her nose, and I asked her why they had not told me about the incident until I had noticed the injuries myself. She told me that she had not called to argue and that she just wanted to let me know that situations like yesterday don't usually happen. I again asked why she did not tell me about the fall, and she said that my daughter's face had been so red from crying, that she didn't notice the injuries, and for that type of incident, they wouldn't tell the parent. I told her that I would not be returning. The policy clearly states that parents will be notified of accidents. She offered to refund me for the ten hour that I had purchased for myself and for the five hour Groupon that I had purchased for my friend.

RESPONSE TO YOUR GENERIC RESPONSE :
I guess laws and regulations are different than common sense and decency. No thanks.  Again,  this is not a money issue,  so please stop trying to make it one. If it was, I would send you her doctor visit receipt as well. I only updated my review to be thorough and fair and to show that your director did not tell me about the fall because she hadn't noticed injuries.  That's unacceptable.  My daughter has a full head of hair and could have had hidden injuries or a concussion that I would have never known about if I hadn't seen for myself. Your director also was the one who originally said she did not fall, changed her story when she saw the blood, and then on the phone admitted that she actually was the one who picked her up off of the floor and consoled her after the fall that didn't happen but did happen. We won't argue about it though. I never said anything about laws. YOUR policy that I signed contradicts your actions. Another insincere and mechanical response won't be necessary. I've already taken the actions that are appropriate in this situation. I'm sure it won't happen to anyone else's child.
Also, Caroline Kimball is the owner. She is writing fake positive reviews for herself on Google."},{"author":"Heather W.","datePublished":"2018-05-17","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"Love this place and the idea! Check in and check out was very smooth and organized. They have different rooms for the ages to play, food was decent price for the meal time, and the hourly rate was affordable. Nice location for going into downtown. We will be using giggles again and again!"},{"author":"C S.","datePublished":"2018-05-19","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"Giggles is Awesome!  I have a 4 year old who absolutely loves going to Giggles.  I am so very pleased with the professional staff and the care that they offer to my child and others.  From the reservation process to the drop off and pick up, they make everything easy and have a particularly friendly staff.  
They give the children their undivided attention and it shows! There is no better thing than asking my son on pick up, how was your time at Giggles?  and he will go on and on about the new friends and "teachers" that he met and played with.  I am also pleased with the safety and security of this childcare facility.  I feel comfortable that they are looking out for my child's well being in every way when he is in their care.  I travel into town for work and Giggles has saved me so much $ on childcare ( I no longer have to pay for the bulk of my travel time just to get to my job!)  It's a win-win in my book! #Gratefulforgiggles"}],"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingValue":4,"reviewCount":5}}

Sounds like it's even getting better.  There was a lot of comradery among the students, and the campus kept safe. I wouldnt send my kids there if it was free..."},{"author":"Jason R.","datePublished":"2016-05-17","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":2},"description":"I went to another school, but a classmate of mine had a Girlfriend that attended this school for arts/music degree.  

As a senior about ready to graduate, she was grounded to campus for 3 months and administration threatened to take away her diploma/degree for being off-campus at a movie theater at 10PM on Saturday night (i.e. past curfew).  She wasn't causing problems in town, just enjoying a movie with a friend.  She complied with the school's gestapo/morality police due to almost being ready to graduate.

Considering people pay good money for tuition to attend this school, they need to give students the ability to have some fun without treating them like mischevious teenagers.  Concur that this school is more of a conservative christian cult center than a University."},{"author":"Raquel C.","datePublished":"2014-05-05","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":3},"description":"This review is surface only.
We came about a month ago for a nationals competition.  The campus is very quaint and beautiful. The trees and the flowers, and landscaping. The facilities were very well kept. The dorms were very nice as well.  As far as I know they have a high school there as well, and I think a daycare or pre school? 
The food was NOT for me, I could stomach the salad bar but the rest had to go! A complete overhaul needs to be done with the menus and ingredients. 
As an overall observation the staff was semi friendly and the students were not so much, a little to much snotty attitude, it turned me off immediately.
This is all my review will be about. It's actually a 2 1/2 star review
I'm really not itching to go back, but whatevs."},{"author":"Stephen D.","datePublished":"2015-04-28","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":1},"description":"Bob Jones University is, in short, a disgrace. It's true. But what is it that makes them a disgrace? Why do they deserve such a title?

Let's examine their academics. Often a freshman-level class is remedial in nature. English classes center around basic grammar, middle school-level vocabulary, and the basics of writing a paper. These are the things one should have learned prior to college. And while a review of the basics can be a good thing, students and their parents are paying thousands of dollars for these remedial courses for the first semester or two! The jump in difficulty after the first year is not something to be ignored either. The average student has to suffer through intensely difficult classes after taking a year to settle into an easier pace. And students soon discover that the grading system used is more of a measuring stick for how much you failed.

You see, students are not treated with respect at this school unless they have proven themselves to the faculty. There are many students who deserve respect at Bob Jones, but unless you're a suck up or a tattle tale, you often are regarded as nothing by the school. I've seen students work extremely hard throughout the year only to be humiliated during class by the teacher. And I've seen students glide through semesters because they were suck ups of the worst kind. Now, don't get me wrong, not all the teachers are bad. But in my experience, there were three kinds of teachers. There were the GAs, which were students working through graduate school. The GAs were pretty much all friendly and helpful. Then there were a handful of good teachers, Dr. Ormiston is an example of a tough but caring teacher. And then you have the rest of the teachers who looked down on most of their students. 

In the end, those who manage to make it through to graduation, will find that in most places, their degree is worthless. Because despite what BJU advertises, they aren't actually accredited. Sure, they're "accredited" by a group of southern religious schools, but that doesn't mean anything outside of Christian circles. That's four years (at least) and thousands upon thousands of dollars wasted, unless you plan to get a job with Bob Jones. And that would probably work out, since those that make it through are trained to think just like the school wants them to think. Students are not prepared for the outside world. The students are trained to fear the secular world, and jump at the mention of something unbiblical. One might call this level of conditioning "brainwashing." And that wouldn't be too far off.

You see, despite claiming the Bible to be their foundation, the school actually wrote their own book of authority. This handbook claims to be inspired by the Bible. But that is an outright lie. While other schools might have rules like "Don't run in the halls." or "Don't bring drugs to school." BJU's rules are "Don't be outside your dormitory past 10:30 PM." and "Don't bring an iPod on campus." In a dystopian fashion, the lives of all the students, be they on or off campus, is invaded by the school's rules. Regulations cover everything from the kind of music they can listen to all the way down having to ask permission to leave campus. Students actually sign a contract that basically states that they will not exercise their first amendment rights.In fact, the school is so paranoid, that they reserve the right to revoke a graduate's diploma within the first three months after a student graduates. There is no appeal process for this. The school can literally make all those years worthless if they decide that you are not the kind of person they want you to be. Of course, they'll keep all the tuition they took from you.

Finally, BJU ignores the concept of grace, while flaunting the concept of judgment. Students have to fear for their safety, lest they break a rule. Students are forced to fill out forms about what they did over break. If they broke any of the rules, they are subject to discipline. If a student is struggling with sin in their life, they cannot seek help. Because the most help a student is offered is mandatory therapy sessions. And that can still come with a side of demerits bringing them closer to suspension or expulsion. They practically thrive on punishing wrongdoers. Unless  the wrongdoer is on their board of directors, as was the case a couple of years ago. It was then that they virtually threatened the entire student body to be silent about what happened. 

BJU is a disgrace. I urge you to stay away."},{"author":"Austin A.","datePublished":"2018-02-14","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":1},"description":"Beautiful campus, there are some lovely people there. However they have allot of rules like what you can and can't we're, or listen to or even watch"},{"author":"rob s.","datePublished":"2005-09-21","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":1},"description":"I could rip this university up but I'll be fair.  It's an ultra conservative 
"bible" university that woman CAN only wear dresses and dating a colored person is still forbidden - YES, you heard me correctly!  This is THAT school that DUBYA once did his speech and got a lot of complaints.  Now they "say" such policy isn't endorsed BUT many, including myself, doubt it.  With my luck, my son will probably say one day: " dad, I want to go to Bob Jones University .................." oh my bejesus!  .............

They claim that they can convert your gay son/daughter to be straight "again" as well  - holy shit, can you make my wife do the dishes too?"},{"author":"Dimitrios K.","datePublished":"2012-02-07","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"After reading some of these novel-like, multi paragraph negative reviews, all I can say is,  WOW! Maybe too much time on their hands, or a cry for some kind of help? 

If indeed a school had such influence in a city or even a state, would it really just stop there? These disgruntled, angry people conveniently  dismiss the fact that there are "many" universities in SC that have more influence e.g. Clemson, Furman, USC etc. 

I attended between '92 -  96 and had a quality education. If one wants to see what the school's really like, then one should take advantage of the many opportunities to visit the campus and find out first hand what a fine school it really is.  There are also opportunities for high school students to live on campus for a few days to experience campus life."},{"author":"Kim W.","datePublished":"2018-07-04","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":4},"description":"I went to BJU in 72-73. If you don't want to obey the rules, you have a choice not to go there. I was happy about the rules. I liked the dress code. At that time, Sunday morning church was on campus and the woman students wore hats. I had several different hats to wear. I loved the food and the campus was beautiful. I have been back to visit three times since 1973, the last being in 2016.  As a student there, I placed in the advanced New Testament Survey class, being that I had previous Bible training at my Christian high school. I always recommend a Christian teenager go to a Christian college or university."},{"author":"Marcy B.","datePublished":"2016-03-17","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"Some of the finest people I know are graduates, faculty, or staff at BJU.  They are truly reasonable, caring people who love and seek to honor the Lord with their lives.  The academic standards seem to still be high after almost 100 years in existence.  No school is perfect (all schools are comprised of imperfect people) but at BJU they are striving for excellence and blessing many lives with their training."},{"author":"R P.","datePublished":"2012-04-25","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":1},"description":"Is it a college or is it a cult? 

Go waste $18000 a year only to get expelled ten days before graduation for posting the lyrics to a Christian song on your facebook page, and then answer that question.

Seriously, if you have to send your kid to a crazy fundamentalist Christian college, at least pick one that is accredited like Clearwater or Liberty. This place is a farce."}],"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingValue":3,"reviewCount":23}}

{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"LocalBusiness","name":"New Beginning College Of Cosmotology","image":"https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/EB75RnmDrPeRSCct6_2i6w/l.jpg","telephone":"(256) 878-6430","address":{"streetAddress":"421 Martling Rd","addressLocality":"Albertville","addressCountry":"US","addressRegion":"AL","postalCode":"35951"},"review":[{"author":"Michelle A.","datePublished":"2017-07-19","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"I don't live in the area, so I had my hair done when I came to town to see some close friends. I had heard from my best friend that there was a cosmetology school nearby. They were easy to find via search on maps online. I've always had good experiences with haircuts, trims and color around the country at cosmetology schools but this was by far the most professional looking school I had ever encountered! I don't know who runs it but I'd like to find out. 

First off, when I went inside, I was greeted by a beautiful, calm, almost spa-like atmosphere instead of the usual smell of perming solution and color. I don't know if I was just there on a good day or if this is the usual way, but bravo to the owner and staff for the ambience. (See picture, had I not been in a hurry that day I think I would have indulged in a full line of services and took many more pictures of the mottos on the walls).

The students and instructors, most of whom I did notice were younger and female, had well put together looks...ranging from conservative to alternative/experimental. The clientele that day were like myself: ranging from middle aged women up to the elderly. 

The young lady who did my hair consult seemed to immediately understand my hair type and I opted to get wash and waves similar to what she was wearing that day. I was going to get a trim but it wasn't necessary and I like that she didn't talk me into unneeded services, something I have unfortunately experienced at many salons.

We had a good chat about a variety of topics as she worked on my look. 

I left there feeling more confident. I should have took a before picture, as my hair was a complete humidity-trashed messed when I had arrived. 

The only downfall to the experience is despite a light dusting of hairspray, my look didn't last two days as I was hoping; it lasted twelve hours. I don't know whether to attribute that to my hair or maybe it needed the humidity-proof hairspray I have used in the past, but all in all, I give Kristen and the others a 5 out of 5 and will definitely return when I am in the area again one day."},{"author":"Kelly C.","datePublished":"2020-09-11","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"Here's an update! {"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"LocalBusiness","name":"McMaster University","image":"https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/aEnvXWCe9bzBSb3B3dz23g/l.jpg","telephone":"(905) 525-9140","address":{"streetAddress":"1280 Main Street W","addressLocality":"Hamilton","addressCountry":"CA","addressRegion":"ON","postalCode":"L8S 4L8"},"review":[{"author":"Owen R.","datePublished":"2021-09-17","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"A great vibe wandering around campus...
Excitement of new beginnings, higher learning.
I like the campus store, quality clothing and reasonable price."},{"author":"Tawny T.","datePublished":"2019-07-01","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"One of the best Universities in Canada , MAC is well known for its Health Sciences.  Pioneering in pedagogical methodology of teaching and learning, it focuses on small groups, problem-based self-directed research and learning versus just being told what to do and memorizing in big lecture halls. MAC has also been innovating in creating new degrees and programs to meet the changing needs of Canada such as joint MD/PhD , joint Bachelor of Health and Business, joint Health and Engineering.  MAC is also the only university with an active stock trading floor.  Unfortunately, unlike University of British Columbia (UBC), it is no where near the beach and doesn't have a nude beach next to it, only a ravine called Cootes Paradise that houses the largest wetland biodiversity in all of Canada ."},{"author":"Kristy N.","datePublished":"2016-01-11","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"How can I dare give anything less than a five star for THE BEST UNIVERSITY AROUND.

GOOOOOOOO MAC! 
As a Marauder, my blood bleeds maroon, but I'm going to be an alumni REAL soon :( 
My reason for choosing this university still remains true, because of Science, because of the students, because of the campus, to that I say I do!

McMaster has been around for almost 130 years (next year I believe is the 130th year). Originally built in Toronto, later moved to Hamilton, McMaster is located in the city of the falls- definitely a beautiful place in the summer and fall to go hiking and explore all of the waterfalls and the trails. Spring, summer, fall and winter, McMaster is beautiful, well actually, spring is not so beautiful, but hey, that's when Lake McMaster reappears in the middle of the campus. Fall however, is LOVELY. Definitely see quite a few people taking their wedding photos here!

Centro, Bistro and Bridges are delicious places to eat. I'm so proud that Mac has such great chefs! Mary Keyes, Bates, Brandon Hall, Hedden Hall, Les Prince, Matthews, McKay, Moulton, Wallingford, Whidden and Woodstock - you've been home to many students at McMaster each year!

Cheers to graduates of 2016!!"},{"author":"Mary T.","datePublished":"2016-02-23","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":3},"description":"I visited McMaster with my manager to conduct co-op interviews. We held six interviews at the John Hodgins Engineering building. 

It had snowed the night before, so it took us twice as long to get there. And, yes, we were late with our first interview. Thank goodness our first candidate was so patient with us.

The staff in room A214 was great showing us the room where we were to conduct our interviews. We also got hot water and tea to start our day right.

Our room was spacious with desks and power outlets. The downside is that it kind of looked like a storage facility. None of our candidates made any remarks about the boxes and such, so we were good.

It was a nice touch that lunch was paid for. We had to go across the street to the medical building (I forget the name of it). It had a fine selection of Tim Hortons, Pizza Pizza, and more products.

Parking is typically expensive on campus. Luckily, the flat rate was capped at $20. The weird thing about the payment kiosk is that the receipt prints in the bottom area, but the plastic flap swings away from you, making it difficult to retrieve your receipt. It took me a good minute to fish it out.

I would be fine returning to McMaster to conduct another set of interviews four months from now and explore the campus more."},{"author":"Christopher F.","datePublished":"2017-11-19","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":4},"description":"Excellent campus in the underrated metro area of Hamilton. Could not believe the amount of study areas encompassed within the campus! Beautiful views of the mouth of Lake Ontario. Plenty of greenery around campus to explore. Exquisite meals in each residence, with help from campus restaurants/bars. Athletic facility is rustic, yet contains all necessities. Lecture halls provide great lighting and spacious seating/work space. Would recommend to anyone that has an appreciation for nature and a clean work environment. All residences were impressive, although the suites were much of the craze. If you can afford the costly prices, a 4 or 6 person suite is the way to go for the best on-campus living experience. Much appreciation for McMaster University and all it has to offer."},{"author":"Bernie C.","datePublished":"2014-06-02","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":4},"description":"I'm slightly biased and I haven't been back here in close to 8 years (crap, I'm old), but I would like to say the following:

-From 2001 to 2005, while I attended, they were constantly adding new buildings, such as new residences, new food vendors, new facilities, etc.
-One of the new facilities was a state-of-the-art gym (as of 2006 when it was built) with an indoor rock climbing wall.  
-The schooling itself was pretty good.  I would say that the math, science and medical programs are excellent while the business (Degroote) is not bad either.  
-I studied business there and while I wouldn't say the actual education was the best, they are very good at placing people in jobs.  I did an internship after my 3rd year and I got placed at PwC as an associate for 1 year.  

While I didn't go back to PwC after my 4th year, it proved to be invaluable experience as it taught me that the real world isn't anything like university. That you couldn't slack off and have no consequences.  That you can't just "cram" your work like you do for test.  It also helped me get a job after graduating.

Verdict: if you study business, try to do an internship.  It'll be very valuable."},{"author":"Markus Zachary Xavier H.","datePublished":"2010-09-15","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"My alma mater so kinda bias that way.  It does have a world class Health Sciences faculty :))) and kick-ass history department.  Where else can u study Russian, Habsburg, Imperial Germany and Imperial Islamic empires under one Humanities roof??? I should have gotten into grad school :(  maybe not cause 'gotten' is not a word, baaaaa!"}],"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingValue":4.5,"reviewCount":7}}

{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"LocalBusiness","name":"Broadwater Elementary School","telephone":"(406) 324-1130","address":{"streetAddress":"900 Hollins Ave","addressLocality":"Helena","addressCountry":"US","addressRegion":"MT","postalCode":"59601"},"review":[{"author":"Tea W.","datePublished":"2019-02-26","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":4},"description":"I went to this wonderful school k-5. Have a wonderful day."},{"author":"Morgan N.","datePublished":"2018-07-09","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":1},"description":"i went to school here from first grade to fifth, and honestly. not great. i had a lot of problems with bullying, the teachers didn't seem to care about their students well being when it came to bullying, or education for that matter. i did have some good teachers, don't get me wrong, but the bad outweighed the good by a lot. one time\nmy fifth grade teacher took me to the back of the room after school and yelled at me to apologize to her, because i had called her out after months of scrutiny and just absurd rudeness to other students as well as myself. other students were SO rude and cliquey, which seems weird for an elementary school. not to say that doesn't happen but it was out of character, i think. i actually moved schools one year because of family reasons, and i was behind on everything. i could go on, there are so many more topics i missed. there was SOME good at this school, i really liked some teachers and there were some fun projects, and i still have some\nfriends from elementary school. but, don't take your chance with this school. if you live in the area, don't consider this school for your kids. just take them somewhere else, it's not worth it."},{"author":"Tessa M.","datePublished":"2012-02-20","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":2},"description":"My children went here one year. We specifically chose this school because it is the one my husband attended as a child and the one in our district was over capacity and not taking more students. We only stayed the one year due to the problems we experienced at this school. Bullying was a major issue amongst the children and none of the staff or administrators seemed to take the issue very seriously at all. Children who were mild mannered were often paired with children who were aggressive and out of control because "they could handle it" even though they were only children. My child specifically was paired with an aggressive child because my child was mild mannered and they considered him a "good influence". While I understand that helping out others should be encouraged, 8 year olds are not counselors and certainly should not be responsible for dealing with aggressive children. When our children left that school, my youngest was a full year behind in math when we transferred to another local school. I was never contacted about there being a problem at all. I also volunteered to be at the school for special events or whatever, but was never called. As a matter of fact, I felt parental involvement was highly discouraged instead of encouraged. The reason we left was to find a better school."}],"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingValue":2.5,"reviewCount":3}}

Forcing full time students to get a crappy meal plan and other such nonsense to support their add-ons. Meaning a half Chick-fil-a, and a gas station-like convenience. Anyways, it is just apparent that they need to work on their care of the students. I was lucky enough to have great starting advisers (Freshman - Sophomore engineering); however, liberal arts department is sorely lacking a great set of advisers.

School isn't overly hard, but definitely harder than a community college and my attendance at UNA. I feel I got a great education despite the complaints above.
